  40RGB = tuple[int, int, int]
  41"rgb tuple of values 0-255"
  42
  43PixelGrid = Int[np.ndarray, "x y rgb"]
  44"rgb grid of pixels"
  45BinaryPixelGrid = Bool[np.ndarray, "x y"]

  48
  49def _fill_edges_with_walls(connection_list: ConnectionList) -> ConnectionList:
  50    """fill the last elements of the connections lists as false for each dim"""
  51    for dim in range(connection_list.shape[0]):
  52        # last row for down
  53        if dim == 0:
  54            connection_list[dim, -1, :] = False
  55        # last column for right
  56        elif dim == 1:
  57            connection_list[dim, :, -1] = False
  58        else:
  59            raise NotImplementedError(f"only 2d lattices supported. got {dim=}")
  60    return connection_list
  61
  62
  63def color_in_pixel_grid(pixel_grid: PixelGrid, color: RGB) -> bool:
  64    for row in pixel_grid:
  65        for pixel in row:
  66            if np.all(pixel == color):
  67                return True
  68    return False

 101@serializable_dataclass(
 102    frozen=True,
 103    kw_only=True,
 104    properties_to_serialize=["lattice_dim", "generation_meta"],
 105)
 106class LatticeMaze(SerializableDataclass):
 107    """lattice maze (nodes on a lattice, connections only to neighboring nodes)
 108
 109    Connection List represents which nodes (N) are connected in each direction.
 110
 111    First and second elements represent rightward and downward connections,
 112    respectively.
 113
 114    Example:
 115      Connection list:
 116        [
 117          [ # down
 118            [F T],
 119            [F F]
 120          ],
 121          [ # right
 122            [T F],
 123            [T F]
 124          ]
 125        ]
 126
 127      Nodes with connections
 128        N T N F
 129        F   T
 130        N T N F
 131        F   F
 132
 133      Graph:
 134        N - N
 135            |
 136        N - N
 137
 138    Note: the bottom row connections going down, and the
 139    right-hand connections going right, will always be False.
 140    """
 141
 142    connection_list: ConnectionList
 143    generation_meta: dict | None = serializable_field(default=None, compare=False)
 144
 145    lattice_dim = property(lambda self: self.connection_list.shape[0])
 146    grid_shape = property(lambda self: self.connection_list.shape[1:])
 147    n_connections = property(lambda self: self.connection_list.sum())
 148
 149    @property
 150    def grid_n(self) -> int:
 151        assert self.grid_shape[0] == self.grid_shape[1], "only square mazes supported"
 152        return self.grid_shape[0]
 153
 154    # ============================================================
 155    # basic methods
 156    # ============================================================
 157    @staticmethod
 158    def heuristic(a: CoordTup, b: CoordTup) -> float:
 159        """return manhattan distance between two points"""
 160        return np.abs(a[0] - b[0]) + np.abs(a[1] - b[1])
 161
 162    def __hash__(self) -> int:
 163        return hash(self.connection_list.tobytes())
 164
 165    def nodes_connected(self, a: Coord, b: Coord, /) -> bool:
 166        """returns whether two nodes are connected"""
 167        delta: Coord = b - a
 168        if np.abs(delta).sum() != 1:
 169            # return false if not even adjacent
 170            return False
 171        else:
 172            # test for wall
 173            dim: int = int(np.argmax(np.abs(delta)))
 174            clist_node: Coord = a if (delta.sum() > 0) else b
 175            return self.connection_list[dim, clist_node[0], clist_node[1]]
 176
 177    def is_valid_path(self, path: CoordArray, empty_is_valid: bool = False) -> bool:
 178        """check if a path is valid"""
 179        # check path is not empty
 180        if len(path) == 0:
 181            if not empty_is_valid:
 182                return False
 183            else:
 184                return True
 185
 186        # check all coords in bounds of maze
 187        if not np.all((0 <= path) & (path < self.grid_shape)):
 188            return False
 189
 190        # check all nodes connected
 191        for i in range(len(path) - 1):
 192            if not self.nodes_connected(path[i], path[i + 1]):
 193                return False
 194        return True
 195
 196    def coord_degrees(self) -> Int8[np.ndarray, "row col"]:
 197        """
 198        Returns an array with the connectivity degree of each coord.
 199        I.e., how many neighbors each coord has.
 200        """
 201        int_conn: Int8[np.ndarray, "lattice_dim=2 row col"] = (
 202            self.connection_list.astype(np.int8)
 203        )
 204        degrees: Int8[np.ndarray, "row col"] = np.sum(
 205            int_conn, axis=0
 206        )  # Connections to east and south
 207        degrees[:, 1:] += int_conn[1, :, :-1]  # Connections to west
 208        degrees[1:, :] += int_conn[0, :-1, :]  # Connections to north
 209        return degrees
 210
 211    def get_coord_neighbors(self, c: Coord) -> CoordArray:
 212        """
 213        Returns an array of the neighboring, connected coords of `c`.
 214        """
 215        neighbors: list[Coord] = [
 216            neighbor
 217            for neighbor in (c + NEIGHBORS_MASK)
 218            if (
 219                (0 <= neighbor[0] < self.grid_shape[0])  # in x bounds
 220                and (0 <= neighbor[1] < self.grid_shape[1])  # in y bounds
 221                and self.nodes_connected(c, neighbor)  # connected
 222            )
 223        ]
 224
 225        output: CoordArray = np.array(neighbors)
 226        if len(neighbors) > 0:
 227            assert output.shape == (
 228                len(neighbors),
 229                2,
 230            ), f"invalid shape: {output.shape}, expected ({len(neighbors)}, 2))\n{c = }\n{neighbors = }\n{self.as_ascii()}"
 231        return output
 232
 233    def gen_connected_component_from(self, c: Coord) -> CoordArray:
 234        """return the connected component from a given coordinate"""
 235        # Stack for DFS
 236        stack: list[Coord] = [c]
 237
 238        # Set to store visited nodes
 239        visited: set[CoordTup] = set()
 240
 241        while stack:
 242            current_node: Coord = stack.pop()
 243            # this is fine since we know current_node is a coord and thus of length 2
 244            visited.add(tuple(current_node))  # type: ignore[arg-type]
 245
 246            # Get the neighbors of the current node
 247            neighbors = self.get_coord_neighbors(current_node)
 248
 249            # Iterate over neighbors
 250            for neighbor in neighbors:
 251                if tuple(neighbor) not in visited:
 252                    stack.append(neighbor)
 253
 254        return np.array(list(visited))
 255
 256    def find_shortest_path(
 257        self,
 258        c_start: CoordTup,
 259        c_end: CoordTup,
 260    ) -> CoordArray:
 261        """find the shortest path between two coordinates, using A*"""
 262        c_start = tuple(c_start)
 263        c_end = tuple(c_end)
 264
 265        g_score: dict[CoordTup, float] = (
 266            dict()
 267        )  # cost of cheapest path to node from start currently known
 268        f_score: dict[CoordTup, float] = {
 269            c_start: 0.0
 270        }  # estimated total cost of path thru a node: f_score[c] := g_score[c] + heuristic(c, c_end)
 271
 272        # init
 273        g_score[c_start] = 0.0
 274        g_score[c_start] = self.heuristic(c_start, c_end)
 275
 276        closed_vtx: set[CoordTup] = set()  # nodes already evaluated
 277        open_vtx: set[CoordTup] = set([c_start])  # nodes to be evaluated
 278        source: dict[CoordTup, CoordTup] = (
 279            dict()
 280        )  # node immediately preceding each node in the path (currently known shortest path)
 281
 282        while open_vtx:
 283            # get lowest f_score node
 284            c_current: CoordTup = min(open_vtx, key=lambda c: f_score[c])
 285            # f_current: float = f_score[c_current]
 286
 287            # check if goal is reached
 288            if c_end == c_current:
 289                path: list[CoordTup] = [c_current]
 290                p_current: CoordTup = c_current
 291                while p_current in source:
 292                    p_current = source[p_current]
 293                    path.append(p_current)
 294                # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 295                # this is the only return statement
 296                return np.array(path[::-1])
 297                # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 298
 299            # close current node
 300            closed_vtx.add(c_current)
 301            open_vtx.remove(c_current)
 302
 303            # update g_score of neighbors
 304            _np_neighbor: Coord
 305            for _np_neighbor in self.get_coord_neighbors(c_current):
 306                neighbor: CoordTup = tuple(_np_neighbor)
 307
 308                if neighbor in closed_vtx:
 309                    # already checked
 310                    continue
 311                g_temp: float = g_score[c_current] + 1  # always 1 for maze neighbors
 312
 313                if neighbor not in open_vtx:
 314                    # found new vtx, so add
 315                    open_vtx.add(neighbor)
 316
 317                elif g_temp >= g_score[neighbor]:
 318                    # if already knew about this one, but current g_score is worse, skip
 319                    continue
 320
 321                # store g_score and source
 322                source[neighbor] = c_current
 323                g_score[neighbor] = g_temp
 324                f_score[neighbor] = g_score[neighbor] + self.heuristic(neighbor, c_end)
 325
 326        raise ValueError(
 327            "A solution could not be found!",
 328            f"{c_start = }, {c_end = }",
 329            self.as_ascii(),
 330        )
 331
 332    def get_nodes(self) -> CoordArray:
 333        """return a list of all nodes in the maze"""
 334        rows: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"]
 335        cols: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"]
 336        rows, cols = np.meshgrid(
 337            range(self.grid_shape[0]),
 338            range(self.grid_shape[1]),
 339            indexing="ij",
 340        )
 341        nodes: CoordArray = np.vstack((rows.ravel(), cols.ravel())).T
 342        return nodes
 343
 344    def get_connected_component(self) -> CoordArray:
 345        """get the largest (and assumed only nonsingular) connected component of the maze
 346
 347        TODO: other connected components?
 348        """
 349        if (self.generation_meta is None) or (
 350            self.generation_meta.get("fully_connected", False)
 351        ):
 352            # for fully connected case, pick any two positions
 353            return self.get_nodes()
 354        else:
 355            # if metadata provided, use visited cells
 356            visited_cells: set[CoordTup] | None = self.generation_meta.get(
 357                "visited_cells", None
 358            )
 359            if visited_cells is None:
 360                # TODO: dynamically generate visited_cells?
 361                raise ValueError(
 362                    f"a maze which is not marked as fully connected must have a visited_cells field in its generation_meta: {self.generation_meta}\n{self}\n{self.as_ascii()}"
 363                )
 364            else:
 365                visited_cells_np: Int[np.ndarray, "N 2"] = np.array(list(visited_cells))
 366                return visited_cells_np
 367
 368    def generate_random_path(
 369        self,
 370        except_when_invalid: bool = True,
 371        allowed_start: CoordList | None = None,
 372        allowed_end: CoordList | None = None,
 373        deadend_start: bool = False,
 374        deadend_end: bool = False,
 375    ) -> CoordArray:
 376        """return a path between randomly chosen start and end nodes within the connected component
 377
 378        Note that setting special conditions on start and end positions might cause the same position to be selected as both start and end.
 379
 380        # Parameters:
 381         - `except_when_invalid : bool`
 382            deprecated. setting this to `False` will cause an error.
 383           (defaults to `True`)
 384         - `allowed_start : CoordList | None`
 385            a list of allowed start positions. If `None`, any position in the connected component is allowed
 386           (defaults to `None`)
 387         - `allowed_end : CoordList | None`
 388            a list of allowed end positions. If `None`, any position in the connected component is allowed
 389           (defaults to `None`)
 390         - `deadend_start : bool`
 391            whether to ***force*** the start position to be a deadend (defaults to `False`)
 392           (defaults to `False`)
 393         - `deadend_end : bool`
 394            whether to ***force*** the end position to be a deadend (defaults to `False`)
 395           (defaults to `False`)
 396
 397        # Returns:
 398         - `CoordArray`
 399            a path between the selected start and end positions
 400
 401        # Raises:
 402         - `ValueError` : if the connected component has less than 2 nodes and `except_when_invalid` is `True`
 403        """
 404
 405        # we can't create a "path" in a single-node maze
 406        assert (
 407            self.grid_shape[0] > 1 and self.grid_shape[1] > 1
 408        ), f"can't create path in single-node maze: {self.as_ascii()}"
 409
 410        # get connected component
 411        connected_component: CoordArray = self.get_connected_component()
 412
 413        # initialize start and end positions
 414        positions: Int[np.int8, "2 2"]
 415
 416        # handle deprecated parameter
 417        if not except_when_invalid:
 418            raise DeprecationWarning(
 419                "except_when_invalid is deprecated. Set it to the default `True` to avoid this warning."
 420            )
 421
 422        # if no special conditions on start and end positions
 423        if (allowed_start, allowed_end, deadend_start, deadend_end) == (
 424            None,
 425            None,
 426            False,
 427            False,
 428        ):
 429            positions = connected_component[
 430                np.random.choice(
 431                    len(connected_component),
 432                    size=2,
 433                    replace=False,
 434                )
 435            ]
 436
 437            return self.find_shortest_path(positions[0], positions[1])
 438
 439        # handle special conditions
 440        connected_component_set: set[CoordTup] = set(map(tuple, connected_component))
 441        # copy connected component set
 442        allowed_start_set: set[CoordTup] = connected_component_set.copy()
 443        allowed_end_set: set[CoordTup] = connected_component_set.copy()
 444
 445        # filter by explicitly allowed start and end positions
 446        if allowed_start is not None:
 447            allowed_start_set = set(map(tuple, allowed_start)) & connected_component_set
 448
 449        if allowed_end is not None:
 450            allowed_end_set = set(map(tuple, allowed_end)) & connected_component_set
 451
 452        # filter by forcing deadends
 453        if deadend_start:
 454            allowed_start_set = set(
 455                filter(
 456                    lambda x: len(self.get_coord_neighbors(x)) == 1, allowed_start_set
 457                )
 458            )
 459
 460        if deadend_end:
 461            allowed_end_set = set(
 462                filter(lambda x: len(self.get_coord_neighbors(x)) == 1, allowed_end_set)
 463            )
 464
 465        # check we have valid positions
 466        if len(allowed_start_set) == 0 or len(allowed_end_set) == 0:
 467            raise ValueError("no valid start or end positions found")
 468
 469        # randomly select start and end positions
 470        start_pos: CoordTup = tuple(
 471            list(allowed_start_set)[np.random.randint(0, len(allowed_start_set))]
 472        )
 473        end_pos: CoordTup = tuple(
 474            list(allowed_end_set)[np.random.randint(0, len(allowed_end_set))]
 475        )
 476
 477        return self.find_shortest_path(start_pos, end_pos)
 478
 479    # ============================================================
 480    # to and from adjacency list
 481    # ============================================================
 482    def as_adj_list(
 483        self, shuffle_d0: bool = True, shuffle_d1: bool = True
 484    ) -> Int8[np.ndarray, "conn start_end coord"]:
 485        return connection_list_to_adj_list(self.connection_list, shuffle_d0, shuffle_d1)
 486
 487    @classmethod
 488    def from_adj_list(
 489        cls,
 490        adj_list: Int8[np.ndarray, "conn start_end coord"],
 491    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
 492        """create a LatticeMaze from a list of connections
 493
 494        > [!NOTE]
 495        > This has only been tested for square mazes. Might need to change some things if rectangular mazes are needed.
 496        """
 497
 498        # this is where it would probably break for rectangular mazes
 499        grid_n: int = adj_list.max() + 1
 500
 501        connection_list: ConnectionList = np.zeros(
 502            (2, grid_n, grid_n),
 503            dtype=np.bool_,
 504        )
 505
 506        for c_start, c_end in adj_list:
 507            # check that exactly 1 coordinate matches
 508            if (c_start == c_end).sum() != 1:
 509                raise ValueError("invalid connection")
 510
 511            # get the direction
 512            d: int = (c_start != c_end).argmax()
 513
 514            x: int
 515            y: int
 516            # pick whichever has the lesser value in the direction `d`
 517            if c_start[d] < c_end[d]:
 518                x, y = c_start
 519            else:
 520                x, y = c_end
 521
 522            connection_list[d, x, y] = True
 523
 524        return LatticeMaze(
 525            connection_list=connection_list,
 526        )
 527
 528    def as_adj_list_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
 529        warnings.warn(
 530            "`LatticeMaze.as_adj_list_tokens` will be removed from the public API in a future release.",
 531            TokenizerDeprecationWarning,
 532        )
 533        return [
 534            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_START,
 535            *chain.from_iterable(
 536                [
 537                    [
 538                        tuple(c_s),
 539                        SPECIAL_TOKENS.CONNECTOR,
 540                        tuple(c_e),
 541                        SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJACENCY_ENDLINE,
 542                    ]
 543                    for c_s, c_e in self.as_adj_list()
 544                ]
 545            ),
 546            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_END,
 547        ]
 548
 549    def _as_adj_list_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
 550        return [
 551            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_START,
 552            *chain.from_iterable(
 553                [
 554                    [
 555                        tuple(c_s),
 556                        SPECIAL_TOKENS.CONNECTOR,
 557                        tuple(c_e),
 558                        SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJACENCY_ENDLINE,
 559                    ]
 560                    for c_s, c_e in self.as_adj_list()
 561                ]
 562            ),
 563            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_END,
 564        ]
 565
 566    def _as_coords_and_special_AOTP(self) -> list[CoordTup | str]:
 567        """turn the maze into adjacency list, origin, target, and solution -- keep coords as tuples"""
 568
 569        output: list[str] = self._as_adj_list_tokens()
 570        # if getattr(self, "start_pos", None) is not None:
 571        if isinstance(self, TargetedLatticeMaze):
 572            output += self._get_start_pos_tokens()
 573        if isinstance(self, TargetedLatticeMaze):
 574            output += self._get_end_pos_tokens()
 575        if isinstance(self, SolvedMaze):
 576            output += self._get_solution_tokens()
 577        return output
 578
 579    def _as_tokens(
 580        self, maze_tokenizer: "MazeTokenizer | TokenizationMode"
 581    ) -> list[str]:
 582        if isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "TokenizationMode"):
 583            maze_tokenizer = maze_tokenizer.to_legacy_tokenizer()
 584        if (
 585            isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "MazeTokenizer")
 586            and maze_tokenizer.is_AOTP()
 587        ):
 588            coords_raw: list[CoordTup | str] = self._as_coords_and_special_AOTP()
 589            coords_processed: list[str] = maze_tokenizer.coords_to_strings(
 590                coords=coords_raw, when_noncoord="include"
 591            )
 592            return coords_processed
 593        else:
 594            raise NotImplementedError(f"Unsupported tokenizer type: {maze_tokenizer}")
 595
 596    def as_tokens(
 597        self,
 598        maze_tokenizer: "MazeTokenizer | TokenizationMode | MazeTokenizerModular",
 599    ) -> list[str]:
 600        """serialize maze and solution to tokens"""
 601        if isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "MazeTokenizerModular"):
 602            return maze_tokenizer.to_tokens(self)
 603        else:
 604            return self._as_tokens(maze_tokenizer)
 605
 606    @classmethod
 607    def _from_tokens_AOTP(
 608        cls, tokens: list[str], maze_tokenizer: "MazeTokenizer | MazeTokenizerModular"
 609    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
 610        """create a LatticeMaze from a list of tokens"""
 611
 612        # figure out what input format
 613        # ========================================
 614        if tokens[0] == SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_START:
 615            adj_list_tokens = get_adj_list_tokens(tokens)
 616        else:
 617            # If we're not getting a "complete" tokenized maze, assume it's just a the adjacency list tokens
 618            adj_list_tokens = tokens
 619            warnings.warn(
 620                "Assuming input is just adjacency list tokens, no special tokens found"
 621            )
 622
 623        # process edges for adjacency list
 624        # ========================================
 625        edges: list[list[str]] = list_split(
 626            adj_list_tokens,
 627            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJACENCY_ENDLINE,
 628        )
 629
 630        coordinates: list[tuple[CoordTup, CoordTup]] = list()
 631        for e in edges:
 632            # skip last endline
 633            if len(e) != 0:
 634                # convert to coords, split start and end
 635                e_coords: list[str | CoordTup] = maze_tokenizer.strings_to_coords(
 636                    e, when_noncoord="include"
 637                )
 638                assert len(e_coords) == 3, f"invalid edge: {e = } {e_coords = }"
 639                assert (
 640                    e_coords[1] == SPECIAL_TOKENS.CONNECTOR
 641                ), f"invalid edge: {e = } {e_coords = }"
 642                coordinates.append((e_coords[0], e_coords[-1]))
 643
 644        assert all(
 645            len(c) == 2 for c in coordinates
 646        ), f"invalid coordinates: {coordinates = }"
 647        adj_list: Int8[np.ndarray, "conn start_end coord"] = np.array(coordinates)
 648        assert tuple(adj_list.shape) == (
 649            len(coordinates),
 650            2,
 651            2,
 652        ), f"invalid adj_list: {adj_list.shape = } {coordinates = }"
 653
 654        output_maze: LatticeMaze = cls.from_adj_list(adj_list)
 655
 656        # add start and end positions
 657        # ========================================
 658        is_targeted: bool = False
 659        if all(
 660            x in tokens
 661            for x in (
 662                SPECIAL_TOKENS.ORIGIN_START,
 663                SPECIAL_TOKENS.ORIGIN_END,
 664                SPECIAL_TOKENS.TARGET_START,
 665                SPECIAL_TOKENS.TARGET_END,
 666            )
 667        ):
 668            start_pos_list: list[CoordTup] = maze_tokenizer.strings_to_coords(
 669                get_origin_tokens(tokens), when_noncoord="error"
 670            )
 671            end_pos_list: list[CoordTup] = maze_tokenizer.strings_to_coords(
 672                get_target_tokens(tokens), when_noncoord="error"
 673            )
 674            assert (
 675                len(start_pos_list) == 1
 676            ), f"invalid start_pos_list: {start_pos_list = }"
 677            assert len(end_pos_list) == 1, f"invalid end_pos_list: {end_pos_list = }"
 678
 679            start_pos: CoordTup = start_pos_list[0]
 680            end_pos: CoordTup = end_pos_list[0]
 681
 682            output_maze = TargetedLatticeMaze.from_lattice_maze(
 683                lattice_maze=output_maze,
 684                start_pos=start_pos,
 685                end_pos=end_pos,
 686            )
 687
 688            is_targeted = True
 689
 690        if all(
 691            x in tokens for x in (SPECIAL_TOKENS.PATH_START, SPECIAL_TOKENS.PATH_END)
 692        ):
 693            assert is_targeted, "maze must be targeted to have a solution"
 694            solution: list[CoordTup] = maze_tokenizer.strings_to_coords(
 695                get_path_tokens(tokens, trim_end=True),
 696                when_noncoord="error",
 697            )
 698            output_maze = SolvedMaze.from_targeted_lattice_maze(
 699                targeted_lattice_maze=output_maze,
 700                solution=solution,
 701            )
 702
 703        return output_maze
 704
 705    @classmethod
 706    def from_tokens(
 707        cls,
 708        tokens: list[str],
 709        maze_tokenizer: "MazeTokenizer | TokenizationMode | MazeTokenizerModular",
 710    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
 711        """
 712        Constructs a maze from a tokenization.
 713        Only legacy tokenizers and their `MazeTokenizerModular` analogs are supported.
 714        """
 715        if isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "TokenizationMode"):
 716            maze_tokenizer = maze_tokenizer.to_legacy_tokenizer()
 717        if (
 718            isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "MazeTokenizerModular")
 719            and not maze_tokenizer.is_legacy_equivalent()
 720        ):
 721            raise NotImplementedError(
 722                f"Only legacy tokenizers and their exact `MazeTokenizerModular` analogs supported, not {maze_tokenizer}."
 723            )
 724
 725        if isinstance(tokens, str):
 726            tokens = tokens.split()
 727
 728        if maze_tokenizer.is_AOTP():
 729            return cls._from_tokens_AOTP(tokens, maze_tokenizer)
 730        else:
 731            raise NotImplementedError("only AOTP tokenization is supported")
 732
 733    # ============================================================
 734    # to and from pixels
 735    # ============================================================
 736    def _as_pixels_bw(self) -> BinaryPixelGrid:
 737        assert self.lattice_dim == 2, "only 2D mazes are supported"
 738        # Create an empty pixel grid with walls
 739        pixel_grid: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"] = np.full(
 740            (self.grid_shape[0] * 2 + 1, self.grid_shape[1] * 2 + 1),
 741            False,
 742            dtype=np.bool_,
 743        )
 744
 745        # Set white nodes
 746        pixel_grid[1::2, 1::2] = True
 747
 748        # Set white connections (downward)
 749        for i, row in enumerate(self.connection_list[0]):
 750            for j, connected in enumerate(row):
 751                if connected:
 752                    pixel_grid[i * 2 + 2, j * 2 + 1] = True
 753
 754        # Set white connections (rightward)
 755        for i, row in enumerate(self.connection_list[1]):
 756            for j, connected in enumerate(row):
 757                if connected:
 758                    pixel_grid[i * 2 + 1, j * 2 + 2] = True
 759
 760        return pixel_grid
 761
 762    def as_pixels(
 763        self,
 764        show_endpoints: bool = True,
 765        show_solution: bool = True,
 766    ) -> PixelGrid:
 767        if show_solution and not show_endpoints:
 768            raise ValueError("show_solution=True requires show_endpoints=True")
 769        # convert original bool pixel grid to RGB
 770        pixel_grid_bw: BinaryPixelGrid = self._as_pixels_bw()
 771        pixel_grid: PixelGrid = np.full(
 772            (*pixel_grid_bw.shape, 3), PixelColors.WALL, dtype=np.uint8
 773        )
 774        pixel_grid[pixel_grid_bw == True] = PixelColors.OPEN
 775
 776        if self.__class__ == LatticeMaze:
 777            return pixel_grid
 778
 779        # set endpoints for TargetedLatticeMaze
 780        if self.__class__ == TargetedLatticeMaze:
 781            if show_endpoints:
 782                pixel_grid[self.start_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.start_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
 783                    PixelColors.START
 784                )
 785                pixel_grid[self.end_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.end_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
 786                    PixelColors.END
 787                )
 788            return pixel_grid
 789
 790        # set solution
 791        if show_solution:
 792            for coord in self.solution:
 793                pixel_grid[coord[0] * 2 + 1, coord[1] * 2 + 1] = PixelColors.PATH
 794
 795            # set pixels between coords
 796            for index, coord in enumerate(self.solution[:-1]):
 797                next_coord = self.solution[index + 1]
 798                # check they are adjacent using norm
 799                assert (
 800                    np.linalg.norm(np.array(coord) - np.array(next_coord)) == 1
 801                ), f"Coords {coord} and {next_coord} are not adjacent"
 802                # set pixel between them
 803                pixel_grid[
 804                    coord[0] * 2 + 1 + next_coord[0] - coord[0],
 805                    coord[1] * 2 + 1 + next_coord[1] - coord[1],
 806                ] = PixelColors.PATH
 807
 808            # set endpoints (again, since path would overwrite them)
 809            pixel_grid[self.start_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.start_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
 810                PixelColors.START
 811            )
 812            pixel_grid[self.end_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.end_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
 813                PixelColors.END
 814            )
 815
 816        return pixel_grid
 817
 818    @classmethod
 819    def _from_pixel_grid_bw(
 820        cls, pixel_grid: BinaryPixelGrid
 821    ) -> tuple[ConnectionList, tuple[int, int]]:
 822        grid_shape: tuple[int, int] = (
 823            pixel_grid.shape[0] // 2,
 824            pixel_grid.shape[1] // 2,
 825        )
 826        connection_list: ConnectionList = np.zeros((2, *grid_shape), dtype=np.bool_)
 827
 828        # Extract downward connections
 829        connection_list[0] = pixel_grid[2::2, 1::2]
 830
 831        # Extract rightward connections
 832        connection_list[1] = pixel_grid[1::2, 2::2]
 833
 834        return connection_list, grid_shape
 835
 836    @classmethod
 837    def _from_pixel_grid_with_positions(
 838        cls,
 839        pixel_grid: PixelGrid | BinaryPixelGrid,
 840        marked_positions: dict[str, RGB],
 841    ) -> tuple[ConnectionList, tuple[int, int], dict[str, CoordArray]]:
 842        # Convert RGB pixel grid to Bool pixel grid
 843        pixel_grid_bw: BinaryPixelGrid = ~np.all(
 844            pixel_grid == PixelColors.WALL, axis=-1
 845        )
 846        connection_list: ConnectionList
 847        grid_shape: tuple[int, int]
 848        connection_list, grid_shape = cls._from_pixel_grid_bw(pixel_grid_bw)
 849
 850        # Find any marked positions
 851        out_positions: dict[str, CoordArray] = dict()
 852        for key, color in marked_positions.items():
 853            pos_temp: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"] = np.argwhere(
 854                np.all(pixel_grid == color, axis=-1)
 855            )
 856            pos_save: list[CoordTup] = list()
 857            for pos in pos_temp:
 858                # if it is a coordinate and not connection (transform position, %2==1)
 859                if pos[0] % 2 == 1 and pos[1] % 2 == 1:
 860                    pos_save.append((pos[0] // 2, pos[1] // 2))
 861
 862            out_positions[key] = np.array(pos_save)
 863
 864        return connection_list, grid_shape, out_positions
 865
 866    @classmethod
 867    def from_pixels(
 868        cls,
 869        pixel_grid: PixelGrid,
 870    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
 871        connection_list: ConnectionList
 872        grid_shape: tuple[int, int]
 873
 874        # if a binary pixel grid, return regular LatticeMaze
 875        if len(pixel_grid.shape) == 2:
 876            connection_list, grid_shape = cls._from_pixel_grid_bw(pixel_grid)
 877            return LatticeMaze(connection_list=connection_list)
 878
 879        # otherwise, detect and check it's valid
 880        cls_detected: typing.Type[LatticeMaze] = detect_pixels_type(pixel_grid)
 881        if not cls in cls_detected.__mro__:
 882            raise ValueError(
 883                f"Pixel grid cannot be cast to {cls.__name__}, detected type {cls_detected.__name__}"
 884            )
 885
 886        (
 887            connection_list,
 888            grid_shape,
 889            marked_pos,
 890        ) = cls._from_pixel_grid_with_positions(
 891            pixel_grid=pixel_grid,
 892            marked_positions=dict(
 893                start=PixelColors.START, end=PixelColors.END, solution=PixelColors.PATH
 894            ),
 895        )
 896        # if we wanted a LatticeMaze, return it
 897        if cls == LatticeMaze:
 898            return LatticeMaze(connection_list=connection_list)
 899
 900        # otherwise, keep going
 901        temp_maze: LatticeMaze = LatticeMaze(connection_list=connection_list)
 902
 903        # start and end pos
 904        start_pos_arr, end_pos_arr = marked_pos["start"], marked_pos["end"]
 905        assert start_pos_arr.shape == (
 906            1,
 907            2,
 908        ), f"start_pos_arr {start_pos_arr} has shape {start_pos_arr.shape}, expected shape (1, 2) -- a single coordinate"
 909        assert end_pos_arr.shape == (
 910            1,
 911            2,
 912        ), f"end_pos_arr {end_pos_arr} has shape {end_pos_arr.shape}, expected shape (1, 2) -- a single coordinate"
 913
 914        start_pos: Coord = start_pos_arr[0]
 915        end_pos: Coord = end_pos_arr[0]
 916
 917        # return a TargetedLatticeMaze if that's what we wanted
 918        if cls == TargetedLatticeMaze:
 919            return TargetedLatticeMaze(
 920                connection_list=connection_list,
 921                start_pos=start_pos,
 922                end_pos=end_pos,
 923            )
 924
 925        # raw solution, only contains path elements and not start or end
 926        solution_raw: CoordArray = marked_pos["solution"]
 927        if len(solution_raw.shape) == 2:
 928            assert (
 929                solution_raw.shape[1] == 2
 930            ), f"solution {solution_raw} has shape {solution_raw.shape}, expected shape (n, 2)"
 931        elif solution_raw.shape == (0,):
 932            # the solution and end should be immediately adjacent
 933            assert (
 934                np.sum(np.abs(start_pos - end_pos)) == 1
 935            ), f"start_pos {start_pos} and end_pos {end_pos} are not adjacent, but no solution was given"
 936
 937        # order the solution, by creating a list from the start to the end
 938        # add end pos, since we will iterate over all these starting from the start pos
 939        solution_raw_list: list[CoordTup] = [tuple(c) for c in solution_raw] + [
 940            tuple(end_pos)
 941        ]
 942        # solution starts with start point
 943        solution: list[CoordTup] = [tuple(start_pos)]
 944        while solution[-1] != tuple(end_pos):
 945            # use `get_coord_neighbors` to find connected neighbors
 946            neighbors: CoordArray = temp_maze.get_coord_neighbors(solution[-1])
 947            # TODO: make this less ugly
 948            assert (len(neighbors.shape) == 2) and (
 949                neighbors.shape[1] == 2
 950            ), f"neighbors {neighbors} has shape {neighbors.shape}, expected shape (n, 2)\n{neighbors = }\n{solution = }\n{solution_raw = }\n{temp_maze.as_ascii()}"
 951            # neighbors = neighbors[:, [1, 0]]
 952            # filter out neighbors that are not in the raw solution
 953            neighbors_filtered: CoordArray = np.array(
 954                [
 955                    coord
 956                    for coord in neighbors
 957                    if (
 958                        tuple(coord) in solution_raw_list
 959                        and not tuple(coord) in solution
 960                    )
 961                ]
 962            )
 963            # assert only one element is left, and then add it to the solution
 964            assert neighbors_filtered.shape == (
 965                1,
 966                2,
 967            ), f"neighbors_filtered has shape {neighbors_filtered.shape}, expected shape (1, 2)\n{neighbors = }\n{neighbors_filtered = }\n{solution = }\n{solution_raw_list = }\n{temp_maze.as_ascii()}"
 968            solution.append(tuple(neighbors_filtered[0]))
 969
 970        # assert the solution is complete
 971        assert solution[0] == tuple(
 972            start_pos
 973        ), f"solution {solution} does not start at start_pos {start_pos}"
 974        assert solution[-1] == tuple(
 975            end_pos
 976        ), f"solution {solution} does not end at end_pos {end_pos}"
 977
 978        return cls(
 979            connection_list=np.array(connection_list),
 980            solution=np.array(solution),
 981        )
 982
 983    # ============================================================
 984    # to and from ASCII
 985    # ============================================================
 986    def _as_ascii_grid(self) -> Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"]:
 987        # Get the pixel grid using to_pixels().
 988        pixel_grid: Bool[np.ndarray, "x y"] = self._as_pixels_bw()
 989
 990        # Replace pixel values with ASCII characters.
 991        ascii_grid: Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"] = np.full(
 992            pixel_grid.shape, AsciiChars.WALL, dtype=str
 993        )
 994        ascii_grid[pixel_grid == True] = AsciiChars.OPEN
 995
 996        return ascii_grid
 997
 998    def as_ascii(
 999        self,
1000        show_endpoints: bool = True,
1001        show_solution: bool = True,
1002    ) -> str:
1003        """return an ASCII grid of the maze"""
1004        ascii_grid: Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"] = self._as_ascii_grid()
1005        pixel_grid: PixelGrid = self.as_pixels(
1006            show_endpoints=show_endpoints, show_solution=show_solution
1007        )
1008
1009        chars_replace: tuple = tuple()
1010        if show_endpoints:
1011            chars_replace += (AsciiChars.START, AsciiChars.END)
1012        if show_solution:
1013            chars_replace += (AsciiChars.PATH,)
1014
1015        for ascii_char, pixel_color in ASCII_PIXEL_PAIRINGS.items():
1016            if ascii_char in chars_replace:
1017                ascii_grid[(pixel_grid == pixel_color).all(axis=-1)] = ascii_char
1018
1019        return "\n".join("".join(row) for row in ascii_grid)
1020
1021    @classmethod
1022    def from_ascii(cls, ascii_str: str) -> "LatticeMaze":
1023        lines: list[str] = ascii_str.strip().split("\n")
1024        lines = [line.strip() for line in lines]
1025        ascii_grid: Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"] = np.array(
1026            [list(line) for line in lines], dtype=str
1027        )
1028        pixel_grid: PixelGrid = np.zeros((*ascii_grid.shape, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
1029
1030        for ascii_char, pixel_color in ASCII_PIXEL_PAIRINGS.items():
1031            pixel_grid[ascii_grid == ascii_char] = pixel_color
1032
1033        return cls.from_pixels(pixel_grid)
1034
1035
1036@serializable_dataclass(frozen=True, kw_only=True)
1037class TargetedLatticeMaze(LatticeMaze):
1038    """A LatticeMaze with a start and end position"""
1039
1040    # this jank is so that SolvedMaze can inherit from this class without needing arguments for start_pos and end_pos
1041    start_pos: Coord
1042    end_pos: Coord
1043
1044    def __post_init__(self) -> None:
1045        # make things numpy arrays (very jank to override frozen dataclass)
1046        self.__dict__["start_pos"] = np.array(self.start_pos)
1047        self.__dict__["end_pos"] = np.array(self.end_pos)
1048        assert self.start_pos is not None
1049        assert self.end_pos is not None
1050        # check that start and end are in bounds
1051        if (
1052            self.start_pos[0] >= self.grid_shape[0]
1053            or self.start_pos[1] >= self.grid_shape[1]
1054        ):
1055            raise ValueError(
1056                f"start_pos {self.start_pos} is out of bounds for grid shape {self.grid_shape}"
1057            )
1058        if (
1059            self.end_pos[0] >= self.grid_shape[0]
1060            or self.end_pos[1] >= self.grid_shape[1]
1061        ):
1062            raise ValueError(
1063                f"end_pos {self.end_pos} is out of bounds for grid shape {self.grid_shape}"
1064            )
1065
1066    def _get_start_pos_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
1067        return [
1068            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ORIGIN_START,
1069            tuple(self.start_pos),
1070            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ORIGIN_END,
1071        ]
1072
1073    def get_start_pos_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
1074        warnings.warn(
1075            "`TargetedLatticeMaze.get_start_pos_tokens` will be removed from the public API in a future release.",
1076            TokenizerDeprecationWarning,
1077        )
1078        return self._get_start_pos_tokens()
1079
1080    def _get_end_pos_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
1081        return [
1082            SPECIAL_TOKENS.TARGET_START,
1083            tuple(self.end_pos),
1084            SPECIAL_TOKENS.TARGET_END,
1085        ]
1086
1087    def get_end_pos_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
1088        warnings.warn(
1089            "`TargetedLatticeMaze.get_end_pos_tokens` will be removed from the public API in a future release.",
1090            TokenizerDeprecationWarning,
1091        )
1092        return self._get_end_pos_tokens()
1093
1094    @classmethod
1095    def from_lattice_maze(
1096        cls,
1097        lattice_maze: LatticeMaze,
1098        start_pos: Coord,
1099        end_pos: Coord,
1100    ) -> "TargetedLatticeMaze":
1101        return cls(
1102            connection_list=lattice_maze.connection_list,
1103            start_pos=start_pos,
1104            end_pos=end_pos,
1105            generation_meta=lattice_maze.generation_meta,
1106        )
1107

1109@serializable_dataclass(frozen=True, kw_only=True)
1110class SolvedMaze(TargetedLatticeMaze):
1111    """Stores a maze and a solution"""
1112
1113    solution: CoordArray
1114
1115    def __init__(
1116        self,
1117        connection_list: ConnectionList,
1118        solution: CoordArray,
1119        generation_meta: dict | None = None,
1120        start_pos: Coord | None = None,
1121        end_pos: Coord | None = None,
1122        allow_invalid: bool = False,
1123    ) -> None:
1124        # figure out the solution
1125        solution_valid: bool = False
1126        if solution is not None:
1127            solution = np.array(solution)
1128            # note that a path length of 1 here is valid, since the start and end pos could be the same
1129            if (solution.shape[0] > 0) and (solution.shape[1] == 2):
1130                solution_valid = True
1131
1132        if not solution_valid and not allow_invalid:
1133            raise ValueError(
1134                f"invalid solution: {solution.shape = } {solution = } {solution_valid = } {allow_invalid = }",
1135                f"{connection_list = }",
1136            )
1137
1138        # init the TargetedLatticeMaze
1139        super().__init__(
1140            connection_list=connection_list,
1141            generation_meta=generation_meta,
1142            start_pos=np.array(solution[0]) if solution_valid else None,
1143            end_pos=np.array(solution[-1]) if solution_valid else None,
1144        )
1145
1146        self.__dict__["solution"] = solution
1147
1148        # adjust the endpoints
1149        if not allow_invalid:
1150            if start_pos is not None:
1151                assert np.array_equal(
1152                    np.array(start_pos), self.start_pos
1153                ), f"when trying to create a SolvedMaze, the given start_pos does not match the one in the solution: given={start_pos}, solution={self.start_pos}"
1154            if end_pos is not None:
1155                assert np.array_equal(
1156                    np.array(end_pos), self.end_pos
1157                ), f"when trying to create a SolvedMaze, the given end_pos does not match the one in the solution: given={end_pos}, solution={self.end_pos}"
1158            # TODO: assert the path does not backtrack, walk through walls, etc?
1159
1160    def __hash__(self) -> int:
1161        return hash((self.connection_list.tobytes(), self.solution.tobytes()))
1162
1163    def _get_solution_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
1164        return [
1165            SPECIAL_TOKENS.PATH_START,
1166            *[tuple(c) for c in self.solution],
1167            SPECIAL_TOKENS.PATH_END,
1168        ]
1169
1170    def get_solution_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
1171        warnings.warn(
1172            "`LatticeMaze.get_solution_tokens` is deprecated.",
1173            TokenizerDeprecationWarning,
1174        )
1175        return self._get_solution_tokens()
1176
1177    # for backwards compatibility
1178    @property
1179    def maze(self) -> LatticeMaze:
1180        warnings.warn(
1181            "`maze` is deprecated, SolvedMaze now inherits from LatticeMaze.",
1182            DeprecationWarning,
1183        )
1184        return LatticeMaze(connection_list=self.connection_list)
1185
1186    @classmethod
1187    def from_lattice_maze(
1188        cls, lattice_maze: LatticeMaze, solution: list[CoordTup]
1189    ) -> "SolvedMaze":
1190        return cls(
1191            connection_list=lattice_maze.connection_list,
1192            solution=solution,
1193            generation_meta=lattice_maze.generation_meta,
1194        )
1195
1196    @classmethod
1197    def from_targeted_lattice_maze(
1198        cls,
1199        targeted_lattice_maze: TargetedLatticeMaze,
1200        solution: list[CoordTup] | None = None,
1201    ) -> "SolvedMaze":
1202        """solves the given targeted lattice maze and returns a SolvedMaze"""
1203        if solution is None:
1204            solution = targeted_lattice_maze.find_shortest_path(
1205                targeted_lattice_maze.start_pos,
1206                targeted_lattice_maze.end_pos,
1207            )
1208        return cls(
1209            connection_list=targeted_lattice_maze.connection_list,
1210            solution=np.array(solution),
1211            generation_meta=targeted_lattice_maze.generation_meta,
1212        )
1213
1214    def get_solution_forking_points(
1215        self,
1216        always_include_endpoints: bool = False,
1217    ) -> tuple[list[int], CoordArray]:
1218        """coordinates and their indicies from the solution where a fork is present
1219
1220        - if the start point is not a dead end, this counts as a fork
1221        - if the end point is not a dead end, this counts as a fork
1222        """
1223        output_idxs: list[int] = list()
1224        output_coords: list[CoordTup] = list()
1225
1226        for idx, coord in enumerate(self.solution):
1227            # more than one choice for first coord, or more than 2 for any other
1228            # since the previous coord doesn't count as a choice
1229            is_endpoint: bool = idx == 0 or idx == self.solution.shape[0] - 1
1230            theshold: int = 1 if is_endpoint else 2
1231            if self.get_coord_neighbors(coord).shape[0] > theshold or (
1232                is_endpoint and always_include_endpoints
1233            ):
1234                output_idxs.append(idx)
1235                output_coords.append(coord)
1236
1237        return output_idxs, np.array(output_coords)
1238
1239    def get_solution_path_following_points(self) -> tuple[list[int], CoordArray]:
1240        """coordinates from the solution where there is only a single (non-backtracking) point to move to
1241
1242        returns the complement of `get_solution_forking_points` from the path"""
1243        forks_idxs, _ = self.get_solution_forking_points()
1244        return (
1245            np.delete(np.arange(self.solution.shape[0]), forks_idxs, axis=0),
1246            np.delete(self.solution, forks_idxs, axis=0),
1247        )
1248
1249
1250def detect_pixels_type(data: PixelGrid) -> typing.Type[LatticeMaze]:
1251    """Detects the type of pixels data by checking for the presence of start and end pixels"""
1252    if color_in_pixel_grid(data, PixelColors.START) or color_in_pixel_grid(
1253        data, PixelColors.END
1254    ):
1255        if color_in_pixel_grid(data, PixelColors.PATH):
1256            return SolvedMaze
1257        else:
1258            return TargetedLatticeMaze
1259    else:
1260        return LatticeMaze
1261
1262
1263def _remove_isolated_cells(
1264    image: Int[np.ndarray, "RGB x y"]
1265) -> Int[np.ndarray, "RGB x y"]:
1266    """
1267    Removes isolated cells from an image. An isolated cell is a cell that is surrounded by walls on all sides.
1268    """
1269    # Create a binary mask where True represents walls
1270    wall_mask = np.all(image == PixelColors.WALL, axis=-1)
1271
1272    # Pad the wall mask to handle edge cases
1273    padded_wall_mask = np.pad(
1274        wall_mask, ((1, 1), (1, 1)), mode="constant", constant_values=True
1275    )
1276
1277    # Check neighbors in all four directions
1278    isolated_mask = (
1279        padded_wall_mask[1:-1, 2:]  # right
1280        & padded_wall_mask[1:-1, :-2]  # left
1281        & padded_wall_mask[2:, 1:-1]  # down
1282        & padded_wall_mask[:-2, 1:-1]  # up
1283    )
1284
1285    # Combine with non-wall mask to only affect open cells
1286    non_wall_mask = ~wall_mask
1287    isolated_mask = isolated_mask & non_wall_mask
1288
1289    # Create the output image
1290    output_image = image.copy()
1291    output_image[isolated_mask] = PixelColors.WALL
1292
1293    return output_image
1294
1295
1296_RIC_PADS: dict = {
1297    "left": ((1, 0), (0, 0)),
1298    "right": ((0, 1), (0, 0)),
1299    "up": ((0, 0), (1, 0)),
1300    "down": ((0, 0), (0, 1)),
1301}
1302
1303# Define slices for each direction
1304_RIC_SLICES: dict = {
1305    "left": (slice(1, None), slice(None, None)),
1306    "right": (slice(None, -1), slice(None, None)),
1307    "up": (slice(None, None), slice(1, None)),
1308    "down": (slice(None, None), slice(None, -1)),
1309}
1310

1312def _remove_isolated_cells_old(
1313    image: Int[np.ndarray, "RGB x y"]
1314) -> Int[np.ndarray, "RGB x y"]:
1315    """
1316    Removes isolated cells from an image. An isolated cell is a cell that is surrounded by walls on all sides.
1317    """
1318    warnings.warn("this functin doesn't work and I have no idea why!!!")
1319    masks: dict[str, np.ndarray] = {
1320        d: np.all(
1321            np.pad(
1322                image[_RIC_SLICES[d][0], _RIC_SLICES[d][1], :] == PixelColors.WALL,
1323                np.array((*_RIC_PADS[d], (0, 0)), dtype=np.int8),
1324                mode="constant",
1325                constant_values=True,
1326            ),
1327            axis=2,
1328        )
1329        for d in _RIC_SLICES.keys()
1330    }
1331
1332    # Create a mask for non-wall cells
1333    mask_non_wall = np.all(image != PixelColors.WALL, axis=2)
1334
1335    # print(f"{mask_non_wall.shape = }")
1336    # print(f"{ {k: masks[k].shape for k in masks.keys()} = }")
1337
1338    # print(f"{mask_non_wall = }")
1339    # print(f"{masks['down'] = }")
1340
1341    # Combine the masks
1342    mask = mask_non_wall & masks["left"] & masks["right"] & masks["up"] & masks["down"]
1343
1344    # Apply the mask
1345    output_image = np.where(
1346        np.stack([mask] * 3, axis=-1),
1347        PixelColors.WALL,
1348        image,
1349    )
1350
1351    return output_image
