@serializable_dataclass(frozen=True, kw_only=True, properties_to_serialize=['lattice_dim', 'generation_meta'])
class LatticeMaze(muutils.json_serialize.serializable_dataclass.SerializableDataclass):
View on GitHub 
 102@serializable_dataclass(
 103    frozen=True,
 104    kw_only=True,
 105    properties_to_serialize=["lattice_dim", "generation_meta"],
 106)
 107class LatticeMaze(SerializableDataclass):
 108    """lattice maze (nodes on a lattice, connections only to neighboring nodes)
 109
 110    Connection List represents which nodes (N) are connected in each direction.
 111
 112    First and second elements represent rightward and downward connections,
 113    respectively.
 114
 115    Example:
 116      Connection list:
 117        [
 118          [ # down
 119            [F T],
 120            [F F]
 121          ],
 122          [ # right
 123            [T F],
 124            [T F]
 125          ]
 126        ]
 127
 128      Nodes with connections
 129        N T N F
 130        F   T
 131        N T N F
 132        F   F
 133
 134      Graph:
 135        N - N
 136            |
 137        N - N
 138
 139    Note: the bottom row connections going down, and the
 140    right-hand connections going right, will always be False.
 141    """
 142
 143    connection_list: ConnectionList
 144    generation_meta: dict | None = serializable_field(default=None, compare=False)
 145
 146    lattice_dim = property(lambda self: self.connection_list.shape[0])
 147    grid_shape = property(lambda self: self.connection_list.shape[1:])
 148    n_connections = property(lambda self: self.connection_list.sum())
 149
 150    @property
 151    def grid_n(self) -> int:
 152        assert self.grid_shape[0] == self.grid_shape[1], "only square mazes supported"
 153        return self.grid_shape[0]
 154
 155    # ============================================================
 156    # basic methods
 157    # ============================================================
 158    @staticmethod
 159    def heuristic(a: CoordTup, b: CoordTup) -> float:
 160        """return manhattan distance between two points"""
 161        return np.abs(a[0] - b[0]) + np.abs(a[1] - b[1])
 162
 163    def __hash__(self) -> int:
 164        return hash(self.connection_list.tobytes())
 165
 166    def nodes_connected(self, a: Coord, b: Coord, /) -> bool:
 167        """returns whether two nodes are connected"""
 168        delta: Coord = b - a
 169        if np.abs(delta).sum() != 1:
 170            # return false if not even adjacent
 171            return False
 172        else:
 173            # test for wall
 174            dim: int = int(np.argmax(np.abs(delta)))
 175            clist_node: Coord = a if (delta.sum() > 0) else b
 176            return self.connection_list[dim, clist_node[0], clist_node[1]]
 177
 178    def is_valid_path(self, path: CoordArray, empty_is_valid: bool = False) -> bool:
 179        """check if a path is valid"""
 180        # check path is not empty
 181        if len(path) == 0:
 182            if not empty_is_valid:
 183                return False
 184            else:
 185                return True
 186
 187        # check all coords in bounds of maze
 188        if not np.all((0 <= path) & (path < self.grid_shape)):
 189            return False
 190
 191        # check all nodes connected
 192        for i in range(len(path) - 1):
 193            if not self.nodes_connected(path[i], path[i + 1]):
 194                return False
 195        return True
 196
 197    def coord_degrees(self) -> Int8[np.ndarray, "row col"]:
 198        """
 199        Returns an array with the connectivity degree of each coord.
 200        I.e., how many neighbors each coord has.
 201        """
 202        int_conn: Int8[np.ndarray, "lattice_dim=2 row col"] = (
 203            self.connection_list.astype(np.int8)
 204        )
 205        degrees: Int8[np.ndarray, "row col"] = np.sum(
 206            int_conn, axis=0
 207        )  # Connections to east and south
 208        degrees[:, 1:] += int_conn[1, :, :-1]  # Connections to west
 209        degrees[1:, :] += int_conn[0, :-1, :]  # Connections to north
 210        return degrees
 211
 212    def get_coord_neighbors(self, c: Coord) -> CoordArray:
 213        """
 214        Returns an array of the neighboring, connected coords of `c`.
 215        """
 216        neighbors: list[Coord] = [
 217            neighbor
 218            for neighbor in (c + NEIGHBORS_MASK)
 219            if (
 220                (0 <= neighbor[0] < self.grid_shape[0])  # in x bounds
 221                and (0 <= neighbor[1] < self.grid_shape[1])  # in y bounds
 222                and self.nodes_connected(c, neighbor)  # connected
 223            )
 224        ]
 225
 226        output: CoordArray = np.array(neighbors)
 227        if len(neighbors) > 0:
 228            assert output.shape == (
 229                len(neighbors),
 230                2,
 231            ), f"invalid shape: {output.shape}, expected ({len(neighbors)}, 2))\n{c = }\n{neighbors = }\n{self.as_ascii()}"
 232        return output
 233
 234    def gen_connected_component_from(self, c: Coord) -> CoordArray:
 235        """return the connected component from a given coordinate"""
 236        # Stack for DFS
 237        stack: list[Coord] = [c]
 238
 239        # Set to store visited nodes
 240        visited: set[CoordTup] = set()
 241
 242        while stack:
 243            current_node: Coord = stack.pop()
 244            # this is fine since we know current_node is a coord and thus of length 2
 245            visited.add(tuple(current_node))  # type: ignore[arg-type]
 246
 247            # Get the neighbors of the current node
 248            neighbors = self.get_coord_neighbors(current_node)
 249
 250            # Iterate over neighbors
 251            for neighbor in neighbors:
 252                if tuple(neighbor) not in visited:
 253                    stack.append(neighbor)
 254
 255        return np.array(list(visited))
 256
 257    def find_shortest_path(
 258        self,
 259        c_start: CoordTup,
 260        c_end: CoordTup,
 261    ) -> CoordArray:
 262        """find the shortest path between two coordinates, using A*"""
 263        c_start = tuple(c_start)
 264        c_end = tuple(c_end)
 265
 266        g_score: dict[CoordTup, float] = (
 267            dict()
 268        )  # cost of cheapest path to node from start currently known
 269        f_score: dict[CoordTup, float] = {
 270            c_start: 0.0
 271        }  # estimated total cost of path thru a node: f_score[c] := g_score[c] + heuristic(c, c_end)
 272
 273        # init
 274        g_score[c_start] = 0.0
 275        g_score[c_start] = self.heuristic(c_start, c_end)
 276
 277        closed_vtx: set[CoordTup] = set()  # nodes already evaluated
 278        open_vtx: set[CoordTup] = set([c_start])  # nodes to be evaluated
 279        source: dict[CoordTup, CoordTup] = (
 280            dict()
 281        )  # node immediately preceding each node in the path (currently known shortest path)
 282
 283        while open_vtx:
 284            # get lowest f_score node
 285            c_current: CoordTup = min(open_vtx, key=lambda c: f_score[c])
 286            # f_current: float = f_score[c_current]
 287
 288            # check if goal is reached
 289            if c_end == c_current:
 290                path: list[CoordTup] = [c_current]
 291                p_current: CoordTup = c_current
 292                while p_current in source:
 293                    p_current = source[p_current]
 294                    path.append(p_current)
 295                # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 296                # this is the only return statement
 297                return np.array(path[::-1])
 298                # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 299
 300            # close current node
 301            closed_vtx.add(c_current)
 302            open_vtx.remove(c_current)
 303
 304            # update g_score of neighbors
 305            _np_neighbor: Coord
 306            for _np_neighbor in self.get_coord_neighbors(c_current):
 307                neighbor: CoordTup = tuple(_np_neighbor)
 308
 309                if neighbor in closed_vtx:
 310                    # already checked
 311                    continue
 312                g_temp: float = g_score[c_current] + 1  # always 1 for maze neighbors
 313
 314                if neighbor not in open_vtx:
 315                    # found new vtx, so add
 316                    open_vtx.add(neighbor)
 317
 318                elif g_temp >= g_score[neighbor]:
 319                    # if already knew about this one, but current g_score is worse, skip
 320                    continue
 321
 322                # store g_score and source
 323                source[neighbor] = c_current
 324                g_score[neighbor] = g_temp
 325                f_score[neighbor] = g_score[neighbor] + self.heuristic(neighbor, c_end)
 326
 327        raise ValueError(
 328            "A solution could not be found!",
 329            f"{c_start = }, {c_end = }",
 330            self.as_ascii(),
 331        )
 332
 333    def get_nodes(self) -> CoordArray:
 334        """return a list of all nodes in the maze"""
 335        rows: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"]
 336        cols: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"]
 337        rows, cols = np.meshgrid(
 338            range(self.grid_shape[0]),
 339            range(self.grid_shape[1]),
 340            indexing="ij",
 341        )
 342        nodes: CoordArray = np.vstack((rows.ravel(), cols.ravel())).T
 343        return nodes
 344
 345    def get_connected_component(self) -> CoordArray:
 346        """get the largest (and assumed only nonsingular) connected component of the maze
 347
 348        TODO: other connected components?
 349        """
 350        if (self.generation_meta is None) or (
 351            self.generation_meta.get("fully_connected", False)
 352        ):
 353            # for fully connected case, pick any two positions
 354            return self.get_nodes()
 355        else:
 356            # if metadata provided, use visited cells
 357            visited_cells: set[CoordTup] | None = self.generation_meta.get(
 358                "visited_cells", None
 359            )
 360            if visited_cells is None:
 361                # TODO: dynamically generate visited_cells?
 362                raise ValueError(
 363                    f"a maze which is not marked as fully connected must have a visited_cells field in its generation_meta: {self.generation_meta}\n{self}\n{self.as_ascii()}"
 364                )
 365            else:
 366                visited_cells_np: Int[np.ndarray, "N 2"] = np.array(list(visited_cells))
 367                return visited_cells_np
 368
 369    def generate_random_path(
 370        self,
 371        except_when_invalid: bool = True,
 372        allowed_start: CoordList | None = None,
 373        allowed_end: CoordList | None = None,
 374        deadend_start: bool = False,
 375        deadend_end: bool = False,
 376    ) -> CoordArray:
 377        """return a path between randomly chosen start and end nodes within the connected component
 378
 379        Note that setting special conditions on start and end positions might cause the same position to be selected as both start and end.
 380
 381        # Parameters:
 382         - `except_when_invalid : bool`
 383            deprecated. setting this to `False` will cause an error.
 384           (defaults to `True`)
 385         - `allowed_start : CoordList | None`
 386            a list of allowed start positions. If `None`, any position in the connected component is allowed
 387           (defaults to `None`)
 388         - `allowed_end : CoordList | None`
 389            a list of allowed end positions. If `None`, any position in the connected component is allowed
 390           (defaults to `None`)
 391         - `deadend_start : bool`
 392            whether to ***force*** the start position to be a deadend (defaults to `False`)
 393           (defaults to `False`)
 394         - `deadend_end : bool`
 395            whether to ***force*** the end position to be a deadend (defaults to `False`)
 396           (defaults to `False`)
 397
 398        # Returns:
 399         - `CoordArray`
 400            a path between the selected start and end positions
 401
 402        # Raises:
 403         - `ValueError` : if the connected component has less than 2 nodes and `except_when_invalid` is `True`
 404        """
 405
 406        # we can't create a "path" in a single-node maze
 407        assert (
 408            self.grid_shape[0] > 1 and self.grid_shape[1] > 1
 409        ), f"can't create path in single-node maze: {self.as_ascii()}"
 410
 411        # get connected component
 412        connected_component: CoordArray = self.get_connected_component()
 413
 414        # initialize start and end positions
 415        positions: Int[np.int8, "2 2"]
 416
 417        # handle deprecated parameter
 418        if not except_when_invalid:
 419            raise DeprecationWarning(
 420                "except_when_invalid is deprecated. Set it to the default `True` to avoid this warning."
 421            )
 422
 423        # if no special conditions on start and end positions
 424        if (allowed_start, allowed_end, deadend_start, deadend_end) == (
 425            None,
 426            None,
 427            False,
 428            False,
 429        ):
 430            positions = connected_component[
 431                np.random.choice(
 432                    len(connected_component),
 433                    size=2,
 434                    replace=False,
 435                )
 436            ]
 437
 438            return self.find_shortest_path(positions[0], positions[1])
 439
 440        # handle special conditions
 441        connected_component_set: set[CoordTup] = set(map(tuple, connected_component))
 442        # copy connected component set
 443        allowed_start_set: set[CoordTup] = connected_component_set.copy()
 444        allowed_end_set: set[CoordTup] = connected_component_set.copy()
 445
 446        # filter by explicitly allowed start and end positions
 447        if allowed_start is not None:
 448            allowed_start_set = set(map(tuple, allowed_start)) & connected_component_set
 449
 450        if allowed_end is not None:
 451            allowed_end_set = set(map(tuple, allowed_end)) & connected_component_set
 452
 453        # filter by forcing deadends
 454        if deadend_start:
 455            allowed_start_set = set(
 456                filter(
 457                    lambda x: len(self.get_coord_neighbors(x)) == 1, allowed_start_set
 458                )
 459            )
 460
 461        if deadend_end:
 462            allowed_end_set = set(
 463                filter(lambda x: len(self.get_coord_neighbors(x)) == 1, allowed_end_set)
 464            )
 465
 466        # check we have valid positions
 467        if len(allowed_start_set) == 0 or len(allowed_end_set) == 0:
 468            raise ValueError("no valid start or end positions found")
 469
 470        # randomly select start and end positions
 471        start_pos: CoordTup = tuple(
 472            list(allowed_start_set)[np.random.randint(0, len(allowed_start_set))]
 473        )
 474        end_pos: CoordTup = tuple(
 475            list(allowed_end_set)[np.random.randint(0, len(allowed_end_set))]
 476        )
 477
 478        return self.find_shortest_path(start_pos, end_pos)
 479
 480    # ============================================================
 481    # to and from adjacency list
 482    # ============================================================
 483    def as_adj_list(
 484        self, shuffle_d0: bool = True, shuffle_d1: bool = True
 485    ) -> Int8[np.ndarray, "conn start_end coord"]:
 486        return connection_list_to_adj_list(self.connection_list, shuffle_d0, shuffle_d1)
 487
 488    @classmethod
 489    def from_adj_list(
 490        cls,
 491        adj_list: Int8[np.ndarray, "conn start_end coord"],
 492    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
 493        """create a LatticeMaze from a list of connections
 494
 495        > [!NOTE]
 496        > This has only been tested for square mazes. Might need to change some things if rectangular mazes are needed.
 497        """
 498
 499        # this is where it would probably break for rectangular mazes
 500        grid_n: int = adj_list.max() + 1
 501
 502        connection_list: ConnectionList = np.zeros(
 503            (2, grid_n, grid_n),
 504            dtype=np.bool_,
 505        )
 506
 507        for c_start, c_end in adj_list:
 508            # check that exactly 1 coordinate matches
 509            if (c_start == c_end).sum() != 1:
 510                raise ValueError("invalid connection")
 511
 512            # get the direction
 513            d: int = (c_start != c_end).argmax()
 514
 515            x: int
 516            y: int
 517            # pick whichever has the lesser value in the direction `d`
 518            if c_start[d] < c_end[d]:
 519                x, y = c_start
 520            else:
 521                x, y = c_end
 522
 523            connection_list[d, x, y] = True
 524
 525        return LatticeMaze(
 526            connection_list=connection_list,
 527        )
 528
 529    def as_adj_list_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
 530        warnings.warn(
 531            "`LatticeMaze.as_adj_list_tokens` will be removed from the public API in a future release.",
 532            TokenizerDeprecationWarning,
 533        )
 534        return [
 535            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_START,
 536            *chain.from_iterable(
 537                [
 538                    [
 539                        tuple(c_s),
 540                        SPECIAL_TOKENS.CONNECTOR,
 541                        tuple(c_e),
 542                        SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJACENCY_ENDLINE,
 543                    ]
 544                    for c_s, c_e in self.as_adj_list()
 545                ]
 546            ),
 547            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_END,
 548        ]
 549
 550    def _as_adj_list_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
 551        return [
 552            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_START,
 553            *chain.from_iterable(
 554                [
 555                    [
 556                        tuple(c_s),
 557                        SPECIAL_TOKENS.CONNECTOR,
 558                        tuple(c_e),
 559                        SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJACENCY_ENDLINE,
 560                    ]
 561                    for c_s, c_e in self.as_adj_list()
 562                ]
 563            ),
 564            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_END,
 565        ]
 566
 567    def _as_coords_and_special_AOTP(self) -> list[CoordTup | str]:
 568        """turn the maze into adjacency list, origin, target, and solution -- keep coords as tuples"""
 569
 570        output: list[str] = self._as_adj_list_tokens()
 571        # if getattr(self, "start_pos", None) is not None:
 572        if isinstance(self, TargetedLatticeMaze):
 573            output += self._get_start_pos_tokens()
 574        if isinstance(self, TargetedLatticeMaze):
 575            output += self._get_end_pos_tokens()
 576        if isinstance(self, SolvedMaze):
 577            output += self._get_solution_tokens()
 578        return output
 579
 580    def _as_tokens(
 581        self, maze_tokenizer: "MazeTokenizer | TokenizationMode"
 582    ) -> list[str]:
 583        if isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "TokenizationMode"):
 584            maze_tokenizer = maze_tokenizer.to_legacy_tokenizer()
 585        if (
 586            isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "MazeTokenizer")
 587            and maze_tokenizer.is_AOTP()
 588        ):
 589            coords_raw: list[CoordTup | str] = self._as_coords_and_special_AOTP()
 590            coords_processed: list[str] = maze_tokenizer.coords_to_strings(
 591                coords=coords_raw, when_noncoord="include"
 592            )
 593            return coords_processed
 594        else:
 595            raise NotImplementedError(f"Unsupported tokenizer type: {maze_tokenizer}")
 596
 597    def as_tokens(
 598        self,
 599        maze_tokenizer: "MazeTokenizer | TokenizationMode | MazeTokenizerModular",
 600    ) -> list[str]:
 601        """serialize maze and solution to tokens"""
 602        if isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "MazeTokenizerModular"):
 603            return maze_tokenizer.to_tokens(self)
 604        else:
 605            return self._as_tokens(maze_tokenizer)
 606
 607    @classmethod
 608    def _from_tokens_AOTP(
 609        cls, tokens: list[str], maze_tokenizer: "MazeTokenizer | MazeTokenizerModular"
 610    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
 611        """create a LatticeMaze from a list of tokens"""
 612
 613        # figure out what input format
 614        # ========================================
 615        if tokens[0] == SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJLIST_START:
 616            adj_list_tokens = get_adj_list_tokens(tokens)
 617        else:
 618            # If we're not getting a "complete" tokenized maze, assume it's just a the adjacency list tokens
 619            adj_list_tokens = tokens
 620            warnings.warn(
 621                "Assuming input is just adjacency list tokens, no special tokens found"
 622            )
 623
 624        # process edges for adjacency list
 625        # ========================================
 626        edges: list[list[str]] = list_split(
 627            adj_list_tokens,
 628            SPECIAL_TOKENS.ADJACENCY_ENDLINE,
 629        )
 630
 631        coordinates: list[tuple[CoordTup, CoordTup]] = list()
 632        for e in edges:
 633            # skip last endline
 634            if len(e) != 0:
 635                # convert to coords, split start and end
 636                e_coords: list[str | CoordTup] = maze_tokenizer.strings_to_coords(
 637                    e, when_noncoord="include"
 638                )
 639                assert len(e_coords) == 3, f"invalid edge: {e = } {e_coords = }"
 640                assert (
 641                    e_coords[1] == SPECIAL_TOKENS.CONNECTOR
 642                ), f"invalid edge: {e = } {e_coords = }"
 643                coordinates.append((e_coords[0], e_coords[-1]))
 644
 645        assert all(
 646            len(c) == 2 for c in coordinates
 647        ), f"invalid coordinates: {coordinates = }"
 648        adj_list: Int8[np.ndarray, "conn start_end coord"] = np.array(coordinates)
 649        assert tuple(adj_list.shape) == (
 650            len(coordinates),
 651            2,
 652            2,
 653        ), f"invalid adj_list: {adj_list.shape = } {coordinates = }"
 654
 655        output_maze: LatticeMaze = cls.from_adj_list(adj_list)
 656
 657        # add start and end positions
 658        # ========================================
 659        is_targeted: bool = False
 660        if all(
 661            x in tokens
 662            for x in (
 663                SPECIAL_TOKENS.ORIGIN_START,
 664                SPECIAL_TOKENS.ORIGIN_END,
 665                SPECIAL_TOKENS.TARGET_START,
 666                SPECIAL_TOKENS.TARGET_END,
 667            )
 668        ):
 669            start_pos_list: list[CoordTup] = maze_tokenizer.strings_to_coords(
 670                get_origin_tokens(tokens), when_noncoord="error"
 671            )
 672            end_pos_list: list[CoordTup] = maze_tokenizer.strings_to_coords(
 673                get_target_tokens(tokens), when_noncoord="error"
 674            )
 675            assert (
 676                len(start_pos_list) == 1
 677            ), f"invalid start_pos_list: {start_pos_list = }"
 678            assert len(end_pos_list) == 1, f"invalid end_pos_list: {end_pos_list = }"
 679
 680            start_pos: CoordTup = start_pos_list[0]
 681            end_pos: CoordTup = end_pos_list[0]
 682
 683            output_maze = TargetedLatticeMaze.from_lattice_maze(
 684                lattice_maze=output_maze,
 685                start_pos=start_pos,
 686                end_pos=end_pos,
 687            )
 688
 689            is_targeted = True
 690
 691        if all(
 692            x in tokens for x in (SPECIAL_TOKENS.PATH_START, SPECIAL_TOKENS.PATH_END)
 693        ):
 694            assert is_targeted, "maze must be targeted to have a solution"
 695            solution: list[CoordTup] = maze_tokenizer.strings_to_coords(
 696                get_path_tokens(tokens, trim_end=True),
 697                when_noncoord="error",
 698            )
 699            output_maze = SolvedMaze.from_targeted_lattice_maze(
 700                targeted_lattice_maze=output_maze,
 701                solution=solution,
 702            )
 703
 704        return output_maze
 705
 706    @classmethod
 707    def from_tokens(
 708        cls,
 709        tokens: list[str],
 710        maze_tokenizer: "MazeTokenizer | TokenizationMode | MazeTokenizerModular",
 711    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
 712        """
 713        Constructs a maze from a tokenization.
 714        Only legacy tokenizers and their `MazeTokenizerModular` analogs are supported.
 715        """
 716        if isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "TokenizationMode"):
 717            maze_tokenizer = maze_tokenizer.to_legacy_tokenizer()
 718        if (
 719            isinstance_by_type_name(maze_tokenizer, "MazeTokenizerModular")
 720            and not maze_tokenizer.is_legacy_equivalent()
 721        ):
 722            raise NotImplementedError(
 723                f"Only legacy tokenizers and their exact `MazeTokenizerModular` analogs supported, not {maze_tokenizer}."
 724            )
 725
 726        if isinstance(tokens, str):
 727            tokens = tokens.split()
 728
 729        if maze_tokenizer.is_AOTP():
 730            return cls._from_tokens_AOTP(tokens, maze_tokenizer)
 731        else:
 732            raise NotImplementedError("only AOTP tokenization is supported")
 733
 734    # ============================================================
 735    # to and from pixels
 736    # ============================================================
 737    def _as_pixels_bw(self) -> BinaryPixelGrid:
 738        assert self.lattice_dim == 2, "only 2D mazes are supported"
 739        # Create an empty pixel grid with walls
 740        pixel_grid: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"] = np.full(
 741            (self.grid_shape[0] * 2 + 1, self.grid_shape[1] * 2 + 1),
 742            False,
 743            dtype=np.bool_,
 744        )
 745
 746        # Set white nodes
 747        pixel_grid[1::2, 1::2] = True
 748
 749        # Set white connections (downward)
 750        for i, row in enumerate(self.connection_list[0]):
 751            for j, connected in enumerate(row):
 752                if connected:
 753                    pixel_grid[i * 2 + 2, j * 2 + 1] = True
 754
 755        # Set white connections (rightward)
 756        for i, row in enumerate(self.connection_list[1]):
 757            for j, connected in enumerate(row):
 758                if connected:
 759                    pixel_grid[i * 2 + 1, j * 2 + 2] = True
 760
 761        return pixel_grid
 762
 763    def as_pixels(
 764        self,
 765        show_endpoints: bool = True,
 766        show_solution: bool = True,
 767    ) -> PixelGrid:
 768        if show_solution and not show_endpoints:
 769            raise ValueError("show_solution=True requires show_endpoints=True")
 770        # convert original bool pixel grid to RGB
 771        pixel_grid_bw: BinaryPixelGrid = self._as_pixels_bw()
 772        pixel_grid: PixelGrid = np.full(
 773            (*pixel_grid_bw.shape, 3), PixelColors.WALL, dtype=np.uint8
 774        )
 775        pixel_grid[pixel_grid_bw == True] = PixelColors.OPEN
 776
 777        if self.__class__ == LatticeMaze:
 778            return pixel_grid
 779
 780        # set endpoints for TargetedLatticeMaze
 781        if self.__class__ == TargetedLatticeMaze:
 782            if show_endpoints:
 783                pixel_grid[self.start_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.start_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
 784                    PixelColors.START
 785                )
 786                pixel_grid[self.end_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.end_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
 787                    PixelColors.END
 788                )
 789            return pixel_grid
 790
 791        # set solution
 792        if show_solution:
 793            for coord in self.solution:
 794                pixel_grid[coord[0] * 2 + 1, coord[1] * 2 + 1] = PixelColors.PATH
 795
 796            # set pixels between coords
 797            for index, coord in enumerate(self.solution[:-1]):
 798                next_coord = self.solution[index + 1]
 799                # check they are adjacent using norm
 800                assert (
 801                    np.linalg.norm(np.array(coord) - np.array(next_coord)) == 1
 802                ), f"Coords {coord} and {next_coord} are not adjacent"
 803                # set pixel between them
 804                pixel_grid[
 805                    coord[0] * 2 + 1 + next_coord[0] - coord[0],
 806                    coord[1] * 2 + 1 + next_coord[1] - coord[1],
 807                ] = PixelColors.PATH
 808
 809            # set endpoints (again, since path would overwrite them)
 810            pixel_grid[self.start_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.start_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
 811                PixelColors.START
 812            )
 813            pixel_grid[self.end_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.end_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
 814                PixelColors.END
 815            )
 816
 817        return pixel_grid
 818
 819    @classmethod
 820    def _from_pixel_grid_bw(
 821        cls, pixel_grid: BinaryPixelGrid
 822    ) -> tuple[ConnectionList, tuple[int, int]]:
 823        grid_shape: tuple[int, int] = (
 824            pixel_grid.shape[0] // 2,
 825            pixel_grid.shape[1] // 2,
 826        )
 827        connection_list: ConnectionList = np.zeros((2, *grid_shape), dtype=np.bool_)
 828
 829        # Extract downward connections
 830        connection_list[0] = pixel_grid[2::2, 1::2]
 831
 832        # Extract rightward connections
 833        connection_list[1] = pixel_grid[1::2, 2::2]
 834
 835        return connection_list, grid_shape
 836
 837    @classmethod
 838    def _from_pixel_grid_with_positions(
 839        cls,
 840        pixel_grid: PixelGrid | BinaryPixelGrid,
 841        marked_positions: dict[str, RGB],
 842    ) -> tuple[ConnectionList, tuple[int, int], dict[str, CoordArray]]:
 843        # Convert RGB pixel grid to Bool pixel grid
 844        pixel_grid_bw: BinaryPixelGrid = ~np.all(
 845            pixel_grid == PixelColors.WALL, axis=-1
 846        )
 847        connection_list: ConnectionList
 848        grid_shape: tuple[int, int]
 849        connection_list, grid_shape = cls._from_pixel_grid_bw(pixel_grid_bw)
 850
 851        # Find any marked positions
 852        out_positions: dict[str, CoordArray] = dict()
 853        for key, color in marked_positions.items():
 854            pos_temp: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"] = np.argwhere(
 855                np.all(pixel_grid == color, axis=-1)
 856            )
 857            pos_save: list[CoordTup] = list()
 858            for pos in pos_temp:
 859                # if it is a coordinate and not connection (transform position, %2==1)
 860                if pos[0] % 2 == 1 and pos[1] % 2 == 1:
 861                    pos_save.append((pos[0] // 2, pos[1] // 2))
 862
 863            out_positions[key] = np.array(pos_save)
 864
 865        return connection_list, grid_shape, out_positions
 866
 867    @classmethod
 868    def from_pixels(
 869        cls,
 870        pixel_grid: PixelGrid,
 871    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
 872        connection_list: ConnectionList
 873        grid_shape: tuple[int, int]
 874
 875        # if a binary pixel grid, return regular LatticeMaze
 876        if len(pixel_grid.shape) == 2:
 877            connection_list, grid_shape = cls._from_pixel_grid_bw(pixel_grid)
 878            return LatticeMaze(connection_list=connection_list)
 879
 880        # otherwise, detect and check it's valid
 881        cls_detected: typing.Type[LatticeMaze] = detect_pixels_type(pixel_grid)
 882        if not cls in cls_detected.__mro__:
 883            raise ValueError(
 884                f"Pixel grid cannot be cast to {cls.__name__}, detected type {cls_detected.__name__}"
 885            )
 886
 887        (
 888            connection_list,
 889            grid_shape,
 890            marked_pos,
 891        ) = cls._from_pixel_grid_with_positions(
 892            pixel_grid=pixel_grid,
 893            marked_positions=dict(
 894                start=PixelColors.START, end=PixelColors.END, solution=PixelColors.PATH
 895            ),
 896        )
 897        # if we wanted a LatticeMaze, return it
 898        if cls == LatticeMaze:
 899            return LatticeMaze(connection_list=connection_list)
 900
 901        # otherwise, keep going
 902        temp_maze: LatticeMaze = LatticeMaze(connection_list=connection_list)
 903
 904        # start and end pos
 905        start_pos_arr, end_pos_arr = marked_pos["start"], marked_pos["end"]
 906        assert start_pos_arr.shape == (
 907            1,
 908            2,
 909        ), f"start_pos_arr {start_pos_arr} has shape {start_pos_arr.shape}, expected shape (1, 2) -- a single coordinate"
 910        assert end_pos_arr.shape == (
 911            1,
 912            2,
 913        ), f"end_pos_arr {end_pos_arr} has shape {end_pos_arr.shape}, expected shape (1, 2) -- a single coordinate"
 914
 915        start_pos: Coord = start_pos_arr[0]
 916        end_pos: Coord = end_pos_arr[0]
 917
 918        # return a TargetedLatticeMaze if that's what we wanted
 919        if cls == TargetedLatticeMaze:
 920            return TargetedLatticeMaze(
 921                connection_list=connection_list,
 922                start_pos=start_pos,
 923                end_pos=end_pos,
 924            )
 925
 926        # raw solution, only contains path elements and not start or end
 927        solution_raw: CoordArray = marked_pos["solution"]
 928        if len(solution_raw.shape) == 2:
 929            assert (
 930                solution_raw.shape[1] == 2
 931            ), f"solution {solution_raw} has shape {solution_raw.shape}, expected shape (n, 2)"
 932        elif solution_raw.shape == (0,):
 933            # the solution and end should be immediately adjacent
 934            assert (
 935                np.sum(np.abs(start_pos - end_pos)) == 1
 936            ), f"start_pos {start_pos} and end_pos {end_pos} are not adjacent, but no solution was given"
 937
 938        # order the solution, by creating a list from the start to the end
 939        # add end pos, since we will iterate over all these starting from the start pos
 940        solution_raw_list: list[CoordTup] = [tuple(c) for c in solution_raw] + [
 941            tuple(end_pos)
 942        ]
 943        # solution starts with start point
 944        solution: list[CoordTup] = [tuple(start_pos)]
 945        while solution[-1] != tuple(end_pos):
 946            # use `get_coord_neighbors` to find connected neighbors
 947            neighbors: CoordArray = temp_maze.get_coord_neighbors(solution[-1])
 948            # TODO: make this less ugly
 949            assert (len(neighbors.shape) == 2) and (
 950                neighbors.shape[1] == 2
 951            ), f"neighbors {neighbors} has shape {neighbors.shape}, expected shape (n, 2)\n{neighbors = }\n{solution = }\n{solution_raw = }\n{temp_maze.as_ascii()}"
 952            # neighbors = neighbors[:, [1, 0]]
 953            # filter out neighbors that are not in the raw solution
 954            neighbors_filtered: CoordArray = np.array(
 955                [
 956                    coord
 957                    for coord in neighbors
 958                    if (
 959                        tuple(coord) in solution_raw_list
 960                        and not tuple(coord) in solution
 961                    )
 962                ]
 963            )
 964            # assert only one element is left, and then add it to the solution
 965            assert neighbors_filtered.shape == (
 966                1,
 967                2,
 968            ), f"neighbors_filtered has shape {neighbors_filtered.shape}, expected shape (1, 2)\n{neighbors = }\n{neighbors_filtered = }\n{solution = }\n{solution_raw_list = }\n{temp_maze.as_ascii()}"
 969            solution.append(tuple(neighbors_filtered[0]))
 970
 971        # assert the solution is complete
 972        assert solution[0] == tuple(
 973            start_pos
 974        ), f"solution {solution} does not start at start_pos {start_pos}"
 975        assert solution[-1] == tuple(
 976            end_pos
 977        ), f"solution {solution} does not end at end_pos {end_pos}"
 978
 979        return cls(
 980            connection_list=np.array(connection_list),
 981            solution=np.array(solution),
 982        )
 983
 984    # ============================================================
 985    # to and from ASCII
 986    # ============================================================
 987    def _as_ascii_grid(self) -> Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"]:
 988        # Get the pixel grid using to_pixels().
 989        pixel_grid: Bool[np.ndarray, "x y"] = self._as_pixels_bw()
 990
 991        # Replace pixel values with ASCII characters.
 992        ascii_grid: Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"] = np.full(
 993            pixel_grid.shape, AsciiChars.WALL, dtype=str
 994        )
 995        ascii_grid[pixel_grid == True] = AsciiChars.OPEN
 996
 997        return ascii_grid
 998
 999    def as_ascii(
1000        self,
1001        show_endpoints: bool = True,
1002        show_solution: bool = True,
1003    ) -> str:
1004        """return an ASCII grid of the maze"""
1005        ascii_grid: Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"] = self._as_ascii_grid()
1006        pixel_grid: PixelGrid = self.as_pixels(
1007            show_endpoints=show_endpoints, show_solution=show_solution
1008        )
1009
1010        chars_replace: tuple = tuple()
1011        if show_endpoints:
1012            chars_replace += (AsciiChars.START, AsciiChars.END)
1013        if show_solution:
1014            chars_replace += (AsciiChars.PATH,)
1015
1016        for ascii_char, pixel_color in ASCII_PIXEL_PAIRINGS.items():
1017            if ascii_char in chars_replace:
1018                ascii_grid[(pixel_grid == pixel_color).all(axis=-1)] = ascii_char
1019
1020        return "\n".join("".join(row) for row in ascii_grid)
1021
1022    @classmethod
1023    def from_ascii(cls, ascii_str: str) -> "LatticeMaze":
1024        lines: list[str] = ascii_str.strip().split("\n")
1025        lines = [line.strip() for line in lines]
1026        ascii_grid: Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"] = np.array(
1027            [list(line) for line in lines], dtype=str
1028        )
1029        pixel_grid: PixelGrid = np.zeros((*ascii_grid.shape, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
1030
1031        for ascii_char, pixel_color in ASCII_PIXEL_PAIRINGS.items():
1032            pixel_grid[ascii_grid == ascii_char] = pixel_color
1033
1034        return cls.from_pixels(pixel_grid)

lattice maze (nodes on a lattice, connections only to neighboring nodes)

Connection List represents which nodes (N) are connected in each direction.

First and second elements represent rightward and downward connections, respectively.

Example: Connection list: [ [ # down [F T], [F F] ], [ # right [T F], [T F] ] ]

Nodes with connections N T N F F T N T N F F F

Graph: N - N | N - N

Note: the bottom row connections going down, and the right-hand connections going right, will always be False.

def nodes_connected( self, a: jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'row_col'], b: jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'row_col'], /) -> bool:
View on GitHub 
166    def nodes_connected(self, a: Coord, b: Coord, /) -> bool:
167        """returns whether two nodes are connected"""
168        delta: Coord = b - a
169        if np.abs(delta).sum() != 1:
170            # return false if not even adjacent
171            return False
172        else:
173            # test for wall
174            dim: int = int(np.argmax(np.abs(delta)))
175            clist_node: Coord = a if (delta.sum() > 0) else b
176            return self.connection_list[dim, clist_node[0], clist_node[1]]

def is_valid_path( self, path: jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'coord row_col'], empty_is_valid: bool = False) -> bool:

178    def is_valid_path(self, path: CoordArray, empty_is_valid: bool = False) -> bool:
179        """check if a path is valid"""
180        # check path is not empty
181        if len(path) == 0:
182            if not empty_is_valid:
183                return False
184            else:
185                return True
186
187        # check all coords in bounds of maze
188        if not np.all((0 <= path) & (path < self.grid_shape)):
189            return False
190
191        # check all nodes connected
192        for i in range(len(path) - 1):
193            if not self.nodes_connected(path[i], path[i + 1]):
194                return False
195        return True

def coord_degrees(self) -> jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'row col']:
View on GitHub 
197    def coord_degrees(self) -> Int8[np.ndarray, "row col"]:
198        """
199        Returns an array with the connectivity degree of each coord.
200        I.e., how many neighbors each coord has.
201        """
202        int_conn: Int8[np.ndarray, "lattice_dim=2 row col"] = (
203            self.connection_list.astype(np.int8)
204        )
205        degrees: Int8[np.ndarray, "row col"] = np.sum(
206            int_conn, axis=0
207        )  # Connections to east and south
208        degrees[:, 1:] += int_conn[1, :, :-1]  # Connections to west
209        degrees[1:, :] += int_conn[0, :-1, :]  # Connections to north
210        return degrees

def get_coord_neighbors( self, c: jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'row_col']) -> jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'coord row_col']:
View on GitHub 
212    def get_coord_neighbors(self, c: Coord) -> CoordArray:
213        """
214        Returns an array of the neighboring, connected coords of `c`.
215        """
216        neighbors: list[Coord] = [
217            neighbor
218            for neighbor in (c + NEIGHBORS_MASK)
219            if (
220                (0 <= neighbor[0] < self.grid_shape[0])  # in x bounds
221                and (0 <= neighbor[1] < self.grid_shape[1])  # in y bounds
222                and self.nodes_connected(c, neighbor)  # connected
223            )
224        ]
225
226        output: CoordArray = np.array(neighbors)
227        if len(neighbors) > 0:
228            assert output.shape == (
229                len(neighbors),
230                2,
231            ), f"invalid shape: {output.shape}, expected ({len(neighbors)}, 2))\n{c = }\n{neighbors = }\n{self.as_ascii()}"
232        return output

def gen_connected_component_from( self, c: jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'row_col']) -> jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'coord row_col']:
View on GitHub 
234    def gen_connected_component_from(self, c: Coord) -> CoordArray:
235        """return the connected component from a given coordinate"""
236        # Stack for DFS
237        stack: list[Coord] = [c]
238
239        # Set to store visited nodes
240        visited: set[CoordTup] = set()
241
242        while stack:
243            current_node: Coord = stack.pop()
244            # this is fine since we know current_node is a coord and thus of length 2
245            visited.add(tuple(current_node))  # type: ignore[arg-type]
246
247            # Get the neighbors of the current node
248            neighbors = self.get_coord_neighbors(current_node)
249
250            # Iterate over neighbors
251            for neighbor in neighbors:
252                if tuple(neighbor) not in visited:
253                    stack.append(neighbor)
254
255        return np.array(list(visited))

return the connected component from a given coordinate

def find_shortest_path( self, c_start: tuple[int, int], c_end: tuple[int, int]) -> jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'coord row_col']:
View on GitHub 
257    def find_shortest_path(
258        self,
259        c_start: CoordTup,
260        c_end: CoordTup,
261    ) -> CoordArray:
262        """find the shortest path between two coordinates, using A*"""
263        c_start = tuple(c_start)
264        c_end = tuple(c_end)
265
266        g_score: dict[CoordTup, float] = (
267            dict()
268        )  # cost of cheapest path to node from start currently known
269        f_score: dict[CoordTup, float] = {
270            c_start: 0.0
271        }  # estimated total cost of path thru a node: f_score[c] := g_score[c] + heuristic(c, c_end)
272
273        # init
274        g_score[c_start] = 0.0
275        g_score[c_start] = self.heuristic(c_start, c_end)
276
277        closed_vtx: set[CoordTup] = set()  # nodes already evaluated
278        open_vtx: set[CoordTup] = set([c_start])  # nodes to be evaluated
279        source: dict[CoordTup, CoordTup] = (
280            dict()
281        )  # node immediately preceding each node in the path (currently known shortest path)
282
283        while open_vtx:
284            # get lowest f_score node
285            c_current: CoordTup = min(open_vtx, key=lambda c: f_score[c])
286            # f_current: float = f_score[c_current]
287
288            # check if goal is reached
289            if c_end == c_current:
290                path: list[CoordTup] = [c_current]
291                p_current: CoordTup = c_current
292                while p_current in source:
293                    p_current = source[p_current]
294                    path.append(p_current)
295                # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
296                # this is the only return statement
297                return np.array(path[::-1])
298                # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
299
300            # close current node
301            closed_vtx.add(c_current)
302            open_vtx.remove(c_current)
303
304            # update g_score of neighbors
305            _np_neighbor: Coord
306            for _np_neighbor in self.get_coord_neighbors(c_current):
307                neighbor: CoordTup = tuple(_np_neighbor)
308
309                if neighbor in closed_vtx:
310                    # already checked
311                    continue
312                g_temp: float = g_score[c_current] + 1  # always 1 for maze neighbors
313
314                if neighbor not in open_vtx:
315                    # found new vtx, so add
316                    open_vtx.add(neighbor)
317
318                elif g_temp >= g_score[neighbor]:
319                    # if already knew about this one, but current g_score is worse, skip
320                    continue
321
322                # store g_score and source
323                source[neighbor] = c_current
324                g_score[neighbor] = g_temp
325                f_score[neighbor] = g_score[neighbor] + self.heuristic(neighbor, c_end)
326
327        raise ValueError(
328            "A solution could not be found!",
329            f"{c_start = }, {c_end = }",
330            self.as_ascii(),
331        )

find the shortest path between two coordinates, using A*

def get_nodes(self) -> jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'coord row_col']:
View on GitHub 
333    def get_nodes(self) -> CoordArray:
334        """return a list of all nodes in the maze"""
335        rows: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"]
336        cols: Int[np.ndarray, "x y"]
337        rows, cols = np.meshgrid(
338            range(self.grid_shape[0]),
339            range(self.grid_shape[1]),
340            indexing="ij",
341        )
342        nodes: CoordArray = np.vstack((rows.ravel(), cols.ravel())).T
343        return nodes

def generate_random_path( self, except_when_invalid: bool = True, allowed_start: list[tuple[int, int]] | None = None, allowed_end: list[tuple[int, int]] | None = None, deadend_start: bool = False, deadend_end: bool = False) -> jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'coord row_col']:
View on GitHub 
369    def generate_random_path(
370        self,
371        except_when_invalid: bool = True,
372        allowed_start: CoordList | None = None,
373        allowed_end: CoordList | None = None,
374        deadend_start: bool = False,
375        deadend_end: bool = False,
376    ) -> CoordArray:
377        """return a path between randomly chosen start and end nodes within the connected component
378
379        Note that setting special conditions on start and end positions might cause the same position to be selected as both start and end.
380
381        # Parameters:
382         - `except_when_invalid : bool`
383            deprecated. setting this to `False` will cause an error.
384           (defaults to `True`)
385         - `allowed_start : CoordList | None`
386            a list of allowed start positions. If `None`, any position in the connected component is allowed
387           (defaults to `None`)
388         - `allowed_end : CoordList | None`
389            a list of allowed end positions. If `None`, any position in the connected component is allowed
390           (defaults to `None`)
391         - `deadend_start : bool`
392            whether to ***force*** the start position to be a deadend (defaults to `False`)
393           (defaults to `False`)
394         - `deadend_end : bool`
395            whether to ***force*** the end position to be a deadend (defaults to `False`)
396           (defaults to `False`)
397
398        # Returns:
399         - `CoordArray`
400            a path between the selected start and end positions
401
402        # Raises:
403         - `ValueError` : if the connected component has less than 2 nodes and `except_when_invalid` is `True`
404        """
405
406        # we can't create a "path" in a single-node maze
407        assert (
408            self.grid_shape[0] > 1 and self.grid_shape[1] > 1
409        ), f"can't create path in single-node maze: {self.as_ascii()}"
410
411        # get connected component
412        connected_component: CoordArray = self.get_connected_component()
413
414        # initialize start and end positions
415        positions: Int[np.int8, "2 2"]
416
417        # handle deprecated parameter
418        if not except_when_invalid:
419            raise DeprecationWarning(
420                "except_when_invalid is deprecated. Set it to the default `True` to avoid this warning."
421            )
422
423        # if no special conditions on start and end positions
424        if (allowed_start, allowed_end, deadend_start, deadend_end) == (
425            None,
426            None,
427            False,
428            False,
429        ):
430            positions = connected_component[
431                np.random.choice(
432                    len(connected_component),
433                    size=2,
434                    replace=False,
435                )
436            ]
437
438            return self.find_shortest_path(positions[0], positions[1])
439
440        # handle special conditions
441        connected_component_set: set[CoordTup] = set(map(tuple, connected_component))
442        # copy connected component set
443        allowed_start_set: set[CoordTup] = connected_component_set.copy()
444        allowed_end_set: set[CoordTup] = connected_component_set.copy()
445
446        # filter by explicitly allowed start and end positions
447        if allowed_start is not None:
448            allowed_start_set = set(map(tuple, allowed_start)) & connected_component_set
449
450        if allowed_end is not None:
451            allowed_end_set = set(map(tuple, allowed_end)) & connected_component_set
452
453        # filter by forcing deadends
454        if deadend_start:
455            allowed_start_set = set(
456                filter(
457                    lambda x: len(self.get_coord_neighbors(x)) == 1, allowed_start_set
458                )
459            )
460
461        if deadend_end:
462            allowed_end_set = set(
463                filter(lambda x: len(self.get_coord_neighbors(x)) == 1, allowed_end_set)
464            )
465
466        # check we have valid positions
467        if len(allowed_start_set) == 0 or len(allowed_end_set) == 0:
468            raise ValueError("no valid start or end positions found")
469
470        # randomly select start and end positions
471        start_pos: CoordTup = tuple(
472            list(allowed_start_set)[np.random.randint(0, len(allowed_start_set))]
473        )
474        end_pos: CoordTup = tuple(
475            list(allowed_end_set)[np.random.randint(0, len(allowed_end_set))]
476        )
477
478        return self.find_shortest_path(start_pos, end_pos)

@classmethod
def from_adj_list( cls, adj_list: jaxtyping.Int8[ndarray, 'conn start_end coord']) -> LatticeMaze:
View on GitHub 
488    @classmethod
489    def from_adj_list(
490        cls,
491        adj_list: Int8[np.ndarray, "conn start_end coord"],
492    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
493        """create a LatticeMaze from a list of connections
494
495        > [!NOTE]
496        > This has only been tested for square mazes. Might need to change some things if rectangular mazes are needed.
497        """
498
499        # this is where it would probably break for rectangular mazes
500        grid_n: int = adj_list.max() + 1
501
502        connection_list: ConnectionList = np.zeros(
503            (2, grid_n, grid_n),
504            dtype=np.bool_,
505        )
506
507        for c_start, c_end in adj_list:
508            # check that exactly 1 coordinate matches
509            if (c_start == c_end).sum() != 1:
510                raise ValueError("invalid connection")
511
512            # get the direction
513            d: int = (c_start != c_end).argmax()
514
515            x: int
516            y: int
517            # pick whichever has the lesser value in the direction `d`
518            if c_start[d] < c_end[d]:
519                x, y = c_start
520            else:
521                x, y = c_end
522
523            connection_list[d, x, y] = True
524
525        return LatticeMaze(
526            connection_list=connection_list,
527        )

create a LatticeMaze from a list of connections

@classmethod
def from_tokens( cls, tokens: list[str], maze_tokenizer: maze_dataset.tokenization.MazeTokenizer | maze_dataset.tokenization.TokenizationMode | maze_dataset.tokenization.MazeTokenizerModular) -> LatticeMaze:
View on GitHub 
706    @classmethod

711    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
712        """
713        Constructs a maze from a tokenization.

def as_pixels( self, show_endpoints: bool = True, show_solution: bool = True) -> jaxtyping.Int[ndarray, 'x y rgb']:
View on GitHub 
763    def as_pixels(
764        self,
765        show_endpoints: bool = True,
766        show_solution: bool = True,
767    ) -> PixelGrid:
768        if show_solution and not show_endpoints:
769            raise ValueError("show_solution=True requires show_endpoints=True")
770        # convert original bool pixel grid to RGB
771        pixel_grid_bw: BinaryPixelGrid = self._as_pixels_bw()
772        pixel_grid: PixelGrid = np.full(
773            (*pixel_grid_bw.shape, 3), PixelColors.WALL, dtype=np.uint8
774        )
775        pixel_grid[pixel_grid_bw == True] = PixelColors.OPEN
776
777        if self.__class__ == LatticeMaze:
778            return pixel_grid
779
780        # set endpoints for TargetedLatticeMaze
781        if self.__class__ == TargetedLatticeMaze:
782            if show_endpoints:
783                pixel_grid[self.start_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.start_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
784                    PixelColors.START
785                )
786                pixel_grid[self.end_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.end_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
787                    PixelColors.END
788                )
789            return pixel_grid
790
791        # set solution
792        if show_solution:
793            for coord in self.solution:
794                pixel_grid[coord[0] * 2 + 1, coord[1] * 2 + 1] = PixelColors.PATH
795
796            # set pixels between coords
797            for index, coord in enumerate(self.solution[:-1]):
798                next_coord = self.solution[index + 1]
799                # check they are adjacent using norm
800                assert (
801                    np.linalg.norm(np.array(coord) - np.array(next_coord)) == 1
802                ), f"Coords {coord} and {next_coord} are not adjacent"
803                # set pixel between them
804                pixel_grid[
805                    coord[0] * 2 + 1 + next_coord[0] - coord[0],
806                    coord[1] * 2 + 1 + next_coord[1] - coord[1],
807                ] = PixelColors.PATH
808
809            # set endpoints (again, since path would overwrite them)
810            pixel_grid[self.start_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.start_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
811                PixelColors.START
812            )
813            pixel_grid[self.end_pos[0] * 2 + 1, self.end_pos[1] * 2 + 1] = (
814                PixelColors.END
815            )
816
817        return pixel_grid
@classmethod
def from_pixels( cls, pixel_grid: jaxtyping.Int[ndarray, 'x y rgb']) -> LatticeMaze:
View on GitHub 
867    @classmethod
868    def from_pixels(
869        cls,
870        pixel_grid: PixelGrid,
871    ) -> "LatticeMaze":
872        connection_list: ConnectionList
873        grid_shape: tuple[int, int]
874
875        # if a binary pixel grid, return regular LatticeMaze
876        if len(pixel_grid.shape) == 2:
877            connection_list, grid_shape = cls._from_pixel_grid_bw(pixel_grid)
878            return LatticeMaze(connection_list=connection_list)
879
880        # otherwise, detect and check it's valid
881        cls_detected: typing.Type[LatticeMaze] = detect_pixels_type(pixel_grid)
882        if not cls in cls_detected.__mro__:
883            raise ValueError(
884                f"Pixel grid cannot be cast to {cls.__name__}, detected type {cls_detected.__name__}"
885            )
886
887        (
888            connection_list,
889            grid_shape,
890            marked_pos,
891        ) = cls._from_pixel_grid_with_positions(
892            pixel_grid=pixel_grid,
893            marked_positions=dict(
894                start=PixelColors.START, end=PixelColors.END, solution=PixelColors.PATH
895            ),
896        )
897        # if we wanted a LatticeMaze, return it
898        if cls == LatticeMaze:
899            return LatticeMaze(connection_list=connection_list)
900
901        # otherwise, keep going
902        temp_maze: LatticeMaze = LatticeMaze(connection_list=connection_list)
903
904        # start and end pos
905        start_pos_arr, end_pos_arr = marked_pos["start"], marked_pos["end"]
906        assert start_pos_arr.shape == (
907            1,
908            2,
909        ), f"start_pos_arr {start_pos_arr} has shape {start_pos_arr.shape}, expected shape (1, 2) -- a single coordinate"
910        assert end_pos_arr.shape == (
911            1,
912            2,
913        ), f"end_pos_arr {end_pos_arr} has shape {end_pos_arr.shape}, expected shape (1, 2) -- a single coordinate"
914
915        start_pos: Coord = start_pos_arr[0]
916        end_pos: Coord = end_pos_arr[0]
917
918        # return a TargetedLatticeMaze if that's what we wanted
919        if cls == TargetedLatticeMaze:
920            return TargetedLatticeMaze(
921                connection_list=connection_list,
922                start_pos=start_pos,
923                end_pos=end_pos,
924            )
925
926        # raw solution, only contains path elements and not start or end
927        solution_raw: CoordArray = marked_pos["solution"]
928        if len(solution_raw.shape) == 2:
929            assert (
930                solution_raw.shape[1] == 2
931            ), f"solution {solution_raw} has shape {solution_raw.shape}, expected shape (n, 2)"
932        elif solution_raw.shape == (0,):
933            # the solution and end should be immediately adjacent
934            assert (
935                np.sum(np.abs(start_pos - end_pos)) == 1
936            ), f"start_pos {start_pos} and end_pos {end_pos} are not adjacent, but no solution was given"
937
938        # order the solution, by creating a list from the start to the end
939        # add end pos, since we will iterate over all these starting from the start pos
940        solution_raw_list: list[CoordTup] = [tuple(c) for c in solution_raw] + [
941            tuple(end_pos)
942        ]
943        # solution starts with start point
944        solution: list[CoordTup] = [tuple(start_pos)]
945        while solution[-1] != tuple(end_pos):
946            # use `get_coord_neighbors` to find connected neighbors
947            neighbors: CoordArray = temp_maze.get_coord_neighbors(solution[-1])
948            # TODO: make this less ugly
949            assert (len(neighbors.shape) == 2) and (
950                neighbors.shape[1] == 2
951            ), f"neighbors {neighbors} has shape {neighbors.shape}, expected shape (n, 2)\n{neighbors = }\n{solution = }\n{solution_raw = }\n{temp_maze.as_ascii()}"
952            # neighbors = neighbors[:, [1, 0]]
953            # filter out neighbors that are not in the raw solution
954            neighbors_filtered: CoordArray = np.array(
955                [
956                    coord
957                    for coord in neighbors
958                    if (
959                        tuple(coord) in solution_raw_list
960                        and not tuple(coord) in solution
961                    )
962                ]
963            )
964            # assert only one element is left, and then add it to the solution
965            assert neighbors_filtered.shape == (
966                1,
967                2,
968            ), f"neighbors_filtered has shape {neighbors_filtered.shape}, expected shape (1, 2)\n{neighbors = }\n{neighbors_filtered = }\n{solution = }\n{solution_raw_list = }\n{temp_maze.as_ascii()}"
969            solution.append(tuple(neighbors_filtered[0]))
970
971        # assert the solution is complete
972        assert solution[0] == tuple(
973            start_pos
974        ), f"solution {solution} does not start at start_pos {start_pos}"
975        assert solution[-1] == tuple(
976            end_pos
977        ), f"solution {solution} does not end at end_pos {end_pos}"
978
979        return cls(
980            connection_list=np.array(connection_list),
981            solution=np.array(solution),
982        )
def as_ascii(self, show_endpoints: bool = True, show_solution: bool = True) -> str:
View on GitHub 
 999    def as_ascii(
1000        self,
1001        show_endpoints: bool = True,
1002        show_solution: bool = True,
1003    ) -> str:
1004        """return an ASCII grid of the maze"""
1005        ascii_grid: Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"] = self._as_ascii_grid()
1006        pixel_grid: PixelGrid = self.as_pixels(
1007            show_endpoints=show_endpoints, show_solution=show_solution
1008        )
1009
1010        chars_replace: tuple = tuple()
1011        if show_endpoints:
1012            chars_replace += (AsciiChars.START, AsciiChars.END)
1013        if show_solution:
1014            chars_replace += (AsciiChars.PATH,)
1015
1016        for ascii_char, pixel_color in ASCII_PIXEL_PAIRINGS.items():
1017            if ascii_char in chars_replace:
1018                ascii_grid[(pixel_grid == pixel_color).all(axis=-1)] = ascii_char
1019
1020        return "\n".join("".join(row) for row in ascii_grid)

1023    def from_ascii(cls, ascii_str: str) -> "LatticeMaze":
1024        lines: list[str] = ascii_str.strip().split("\n")
1025        lines = [line.strip() for line in lines]
1026        ascii_grid: Shaped[np.ndarray, "x y"] = np.array(
1027            [list(line) for line in lines], dtype=str
1028        )
1029        pixel_grid: PixelGrid = np.zeros((*ascii_grid.shape, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
1030

1032            pixel_grid[ascii_grid == ascii_char] = pixel_color
1033
1034        return cls.from_pixels(pixel_grid)
def serialize(self) -> dict[str, typing.Any]:
View on GitHub 
520        def serialize(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
521            result: dict[str, Any] = {
522                "__format__": f"{self.__class__.__name__}(SerializableDataclass)"
523            }
524            # for each field in the class
525            for field in dataclasses.fields(self):  # type: ignore[arg-type]
526                # need it to be our special SerializableField
527                if not isinstance(field, SerializableField):
528                    raise ValueError(
529                        f"Field '{field.name}' on class {self.__class__.__module__}.{self.__class__.__name__} is not a SerializableField, "
530                        f"but a {type(field)} "
531                        "this state should be inaccessible, please report this bug!"
532                    )
533
534                # try to save it
535                if field.serialize:
536                    try:
537                        # get the val
538                        value = getattr(self, field.name)
539                        # if it is a serializable dataclass, serialize it
540                        if isinstance(value, SerializableDataclass):
541                            value = value.serialize()
542                        # if the value has a serialization function, use that
543                        if hasattr(value, "serialize") and callable(value.serialize):
544                            value = value.serialize()
545                        # if the field has a serialization function, use that
546                        # it would be nice to be able to override a class's `.serialize()`, but that could lead to some inconsistencies!
547                        elif field.serialization_fn:
548                            value = field.serialization_fn(value)
549
550                        # store the value in the result
551                        result[field.name] = value
552                    except Exception as e:
553                        raise ValueError(
554                            "\n".join(
555                                [
556                                    f"Error serializing field '{field.name}' on class {self.__class__.__module__}.{self.__class__.__name__}",
557                                    f"{field = }",
558                                    f"{value = }",
559                                    f"{self = }",
560                                ]
561                            )
562                        ) from e
563
564            # store each property if we can get it
565            for prop in self._properties_to_serialize:
566                if hasattr(cls, prop):
567                    value = getattr(self, prop)
568                    result[prop] = value
569                else:
570                    raise AttributeError(
571                        f"Cannot serialize property '{prop}' on class {self.__class__.__module__}.{self.__class__.__name__}"
572                        + f"but it is in {self._properties_to_serialize = }"
573                        + f"\n{self = }"
574                    )
575
576            return result
@classmethod
def load(cls, data: Union[dict[str, Any], ~T]) -> Type[~T]:
View on GitHub 
583        @classmethod  # type: ignore[misc]
584        def load(cls, data: dict[str, Any] | T) -> Type[T]:
585            # HACK: this is kind of ugly, but it fixes a lot of issues for when we do recursive loading with ZANJ
586            if isinstance(data, cls):
587                return data
588
589            assert isinstance(
590                data, typing.Mapping
591            ), f"When loading {cls.__name__ = } expected a Mapping, but got {type(data) = }:\n{data = }"
592
593            cls_type_hints: dict[str, Any] = get_cls_type_hints(cls)
594
595            # initialize dict for keeping what we will pass to the constructor
596            ctor_kwargs: dict[str, Any] = dict()
597
598            # iterate over the fields of the class
599            for field in dataclasses.fields(cls):
600                # check if the field is a SerializableField
601                assert isinstance(
602                    field, SerializableField
603                ), f"Field '{field.name}' on class {cls.__name__} is not a SerializableField, but a {type(field)}. this state should be inaccessible, please report this bug!\nhttps://github.com/mivanit/muutils/issues/new"
604
605                # check if the field is in the data and if it should be initialized
606                if (field.name in data) and field.init:
607                    # get the value, we will be processing it
608                    value: Any = data[field.name]
609
610                    # get the type hint for the field
611                    field_type_hint: Any = cls_type_hints.get(field.name, None)
612
613                    # we rely on the init of `SerializableField` to check that only one of `loading_fn` and `deserialize_fn` is set
614                    if field.deserialize_fn:
615                        # if it has a deserialization function, use that
616                        value = field.deserialize_fn(value)
617                    elif field.loading_fn:
618                        # if it has a loading function, use that
619                        value = field.loading_fn(data)
620                    elif (
621                        field_type_hint is not None
622                        and hasattr(field_type_hint, "load")
623                        and callable(field_type_hint.load)
624                    ):
625                        # if no loading function but has a type hint with a load method, use that
626                        if isinstance(value, dict):
627                            value = field_type_hint.load(value)
628                        else:
629                            raise ValueError(
630                                f"Cannot load value into {field_type_hint}, expected {type(value) = } to be a dict\n{value = }"
631                            )
632                    else:
633                        # assume no loading needs to happen, keep `value` as-is
634                        pass
635
636                    # store the value in the constructor kwargs
637                    ctor_kwargs[field.name] = value
638
639            # create a new instance of the class with the constructor kwargs
640            output: cls = cls(**ctor_kwargs)
641
642            # validate the types of the fields if needed
643            if on_typecheck_mismatch != ErrorMode.IGNORE:
644                output.validate_fields_types(on_typecheck_error=on_typecheck_error)
645
646            # return the new instance
647            return output
def validate_fields_types( self: muutils.json_serialize.serializable_dataclass.SerializableDataclass, on_typecheck_error: muutils.errormode.ErrorMode = ErrorMode.Except) -> bool:
View on GitHub

214) -> bool:
215    """validate the types of all the fields on a SerializableDataclass. calls `SerializableDataclass__validate_field_type` for each field"""
216    return all(
217        SerializableDataclass__validate_fields_types__dict(

1110@serializable_dataclass(frozen=True, kw_only=True)
1111class SolvedMaze(TargetedLatticeMaze):
1112    """Stores a maze and a solution"""
1113
1114    solution: CoordArray
1115
1116    def __init__(
1117        self,
1118        connection_list: ConnectionList,
1119        solution: CoordArray,
1120        generation_meta: dict | None = None,
1121        start_pos: Coord | None = None,
1122        end_pos: Coord | None = None,
1123        allow_invalid: bool = False,
1124    ) -> None:
1125        # figure out the solution
1126        solution_valid: bool = False
1127        if solution is not None:
1128            solution = np.array(solution)
1129            # note that a path length of 1 here is valid, since the start and end pos could be the same
1130            if (solution.shape[0] > 0) and (solution.shape[1] == 2):
1131                solution_valid = True
1132
1133        if not solution_valid and not allow_invalid:
1134            raise ValueError(
1135                f"invalid solution: {solution.shape = } {solution = } {solution_valid = } {allow_invalid = }",
1136                f"{connection_list = }",
1137            )
1138
1139        # init the TargetedLatticeMaze
1140        super().__init__(
1141            connection_list=connection_list,
1142            generation_meta=generation_meta,
1143            start_pos=np.array(solution[0]) if solution_valid else None,
1144            end_pos=np.array(solution[-1]) if solution_valid else None,
1145        )
1146
1147        self.__dict__["solution"] = solution
1148
1149        # adjust the endpoints
1150        if not allow_invalid:
1151            if start_pos is not None:
1152                assert np.array_equal(
1153                    np.array(start_pos), self.start_pos
1154                ), f"when trying to create a SolvedMaze, the given start_pos does not match the one in the solution: given={start_pos}, solution={self.start_pos}"
1155            if end_pos is not None:
1156                assert np.array_equal(
1157                    np.array(end_pos), self.end_pos
1158                ), f"when trying to create a SolvedMaze, the given end_pos does not match the one in the solution: given={end_pos}, solution={self.end_pos}"
1159            # TODO: assert the path does not backtrack, walk through walls, etc?
1160
1161    def __hash__(self) -> int:
1162        return hash((self.connection_list.tobytes(), self.solution.tobytes()))
1163
1164    def _get_solution_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
1165        return [
1166            SPECIAL_TOKENS.PATH_START,
1167            *[tuple(c) for c in self.solution],
1168            SPECIAL_TOKENS.PATH_END,
1169        ]
1170
1171    def get_solution_tokens(self) -> list[str | CoordTup]:
1172        warnings.warn(
1173            "`LatticeMaze.get_solution_tokens` is deprecated.",
1174            TokenizerDeprecationWarning,
1175        )
1176        return self._get_solution_tokens()
1177
1178    # for backwards compatibility
1179    @property
1180    def maze(self) -> LatticeMaze:
1181        warnings.warn(
1182            "`maze` is deprecated, SolvedMaze now inherits from LatticeMaze.",
1183            DeprecationWarning,
1184        )
1185        return LatticeMaze(connection_list=self.connection_list)
1186
1187    @classmethod
1188    def from_lattice_maze(
1189        cls, lattice_maze: LatticeMaze, solution: list[CoordTup]
1190    ) -> "SolvedMaze":
1191        return cls(
1192            connection_list=lattice_maze.connection_list,
1193            solution=solution,
1194            generation_meta=lattice_maze.generation_meta,
1195        )
1196
1197    @classmethod
1198    def from_targeted_lattice_maze(
1199        cls,
1200        targeted_lattice_maze: TargetedLatticeMaze,
1201        solution: list[CoordTup] | None = None,
1202    ) -> "SolvedMaze":
1203        """solves the given targeted lattice maze and returns a SolvedMaze"""
1204        if solution is None:
1205            solution = targeted_lattice_maze.find_shortest_path(
1206                targeted_lattice_maze.start_pos,
1207                targeted_lattice_maze.end_pos,
1208            )
1209        return cls(
1210            connection_list=targeted_lattice_maze.connection_list,
1211            solution=np.array(solution),
1212            generation_meta=targeted_lattice_maze.generation_meta,
1213        )
1214
1215    def get_solution_forking_points(
1216        self,
1217        always_include_endpoints: bool = False,
1218    ) -> tuple[list[int], CoordArray]:
1219        """coordinates and their indicies from the solution where a fork is present
1220
1221        - if the start point is not a dead end, this counts as a fork
1222        - if the end point is not a dead end, this counts as a fork
1223        """
1224        output_idxs: list[int] = list()
1225        output_coords: list[CoordTup] = list()
1226
1227        for idx, coord in enumerate(self.solution):
1228            # more than one choice for first coord, or more than 2 for any other
1229            # since the previous coord doesn't count as a choice
1230            is_endpoint: bool = idx == 0 or idx == self.solution.shape[0] - 1
1231            theshold: int = 1 if is_endpoint else 2
1232            if self.get_coord_neighbors(coord).shape[0] > theshold or (
1233                is_endpoint and always_include_endpoints
1234            ):
1235                output_idxs.append(idx)
1236                output_coords.append(coord)
1237
1238        return output_idxs, np.array(output_coords)
1239
1240    def get_solution_path_following_points(self) -> tuple[list[int], CoordArray]:
1241        """coordinates from the solution where there is only a single (non-backtracking) point to move to
1242
1243        returns the complement of `get_solution_forking_points` from the path"""
1244        forks_idxs, _ = self.get_solution_forking_points()
1245        return (
1246            np.delete(np.arange(self.solution.shape[0]), forks_idxs, axis=0),
1247            np.delete(self.solution, forks_idxs, axis=0),
1248        )

1116    def __init__(
1117        self,
1118        connection_list: ConnectionList,
1119        solution: CoordArray,
1120        generation_meta: dict | None = None,
1121        start_pos: Coord | None = None,
1122        end_pos: Coord | None = None,
1123        allow_invalid: bool = False,
1124    ) -> None:
1125        # figure out the solution
1126        solution_valid: bool = False
1127        if solution is not None:
1128            solution = np.array(solution)
1129            # note that a path length of 1 here is valid, since the start and end pos could be the same
1130            if (solution.shape[0] > 0) and (solution.shape[1] == 2):
1131                solution_valid = True
1132
1133        if not solution_valid and not allow_invalid:
1134            raise ValueError(
1135                f"invalid solution: {solution.shape = } {solution = } {solution_valid = } {allow_invalid = }",
1136                f"{connection_list = }",
1137            )
1138
1139        # init the TargetedLatticeMaze
1140        super().__init__(
1141            connection_list=connection_list,
1142            generation_meta=generation_meta,
1143            start_pos=np.array(solution[0]) if solution_valid else None,
1144            end_pos=np.array(solution[-1]) if solution_valid else None,
1145        )
1146
1147        self.__dict__["solution"] = solution
1148
1149        # adjust the endpoints
1150        if not allow_invalid:
1151            if start_pos is not None:
1152                assert np.array_equal(
1153                    np.array(start_pos), self.start_pos
1154                ), f"when trying to create a SolvedMaze, the given start_pos does not match the one in the solution: given={start_pos}, solution={self.start_pos}"
1155            if end_pos is not None:
1156                assert np.array_equal(
1157                    np.array(end_pos), self.end_pos
1158                ), f"when trying to create a SolvedMaze, the given end_pos does not match the one in the solution: given={end_pos}, solution={self.end_pos}"
1159            # TODO: assert the path does not backtrack, walk through walls, etc?
